loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 48-year-old lady who is married and has  six children, three of whom are in school.  She lives in the city outskirts of Kabowa in Kampala district.  She is a business lady dealing in textile (selling cloths). She has been a client of UGAFODE since 2007. 

Rachael has been able to boost her business using loan facilities from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI), however she faces the challenge of competition from the neighboring shops and high rent costs.  She has applied for a loan facility of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more stock of bitenge -- a popular African wear,  in bulk so that she can make more income in form of profits. She will repay this loan using the proceeds from the business.

Rachael is so grateful to UGAFODE for the financial support that has enabled her to educate her children, and she suggests that interest rates be reduced further.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 39 years old and married with three dependent children. She lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, earning a living through growing beans and farming rice.  She has been in this business for 19 years to meet her family’s need.  Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 20,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 5,000 each day for their future needs.

This is Sinat’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the previous loan to better her living condition.  Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sinat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 30 years old and five of her children are in school.

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years.  Rowena requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials like net, gasoline, wood, etc.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fishing materials

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy is a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 51 years old and also a mother of one child. The main source of income for her family comes from a pineapple farm which she has occupied for about seven years already. The yield of pineapples pays for her family expenses and her child's school expenses. For this cycle, she is the leader of a group of two members who are first-time borrowers of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They request a loan of 2,000,000 KHR which will be allocated to an equal share of 1,000,000 KHR for each partner. As the leader, Thy plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and more pineapples to plant. She hopes that the loan will pave a way for her family to a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more pineapples to plant.

loans.name: Cheng's Group

texts.en:
Cheng is a villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaug Khum district.  She is 59 years old and married with six children. She earns a living through farming rice for 39 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from their current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for their future needs. 

This is the fourth loan for Cheng with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund has helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sung's Group

texts.en:
Sung is a resident of Battambang province.  Her family consisting of nine children, four of whom are in school.  Sung is 49 years old and is a farmer who strives for a living via rice farming, which is her only source of income.  This is the second loan for Sung with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely. 

For this cycle, Sung forms a group of two to get a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene aimed to improve her business and increase her income to support the education of her children and satisfy their daily necessities. She is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children. She is engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within the local community to help her husband in gaining income. She would like to prepare more kinds of snack recipes to sell but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she wants a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy flour, fish balls, bananas, sweet potatoes, seasonings and coconut juice to sell. She is hoping that she will avail her loan request to improve the business.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Femy

texts.en: Femy is a responsible mother who owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. She is 43 years old and has three school-aged children. Due to high cost of school fees, she aims to improve her business and increase her income to support the education of her children and satisfy their necessities. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has not enough capital. For this reason, Femy is asking for a loan of 15,000.00 PHP to buy more stocks of beverages, assorted candies, seasonings, breads, soft drinks and frozen foods to resell. Through her patience and strong determination, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beverages, assorted candies, seasonings, breads, soft drinks and frozen foods to resell.

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey is a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She deals with her daily cost of living via rice farming in order to support her two children who remain in school. Including this loan, Srey is a fourth-cycled borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loans completely and they have  enabled her to uplift her lifestyle at a gradual pace.   Srey will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fee. She strongly hopes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: buy farm inputs & pay for plowing

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Nin is 53 years old and married. She has two children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. Having been in this business for 35 years, she is able to earn daily income of KHR 27,000 to support her family and she can save about KHR 10,000 per day for the future needs. 

This is the second loan for Nin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a  loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living and have a bigger house for living in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Pharet's Group

texts.en:
Pharet is aged 33 and married. Her family lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province and she and her husband earn a living through working as tailors in the village. The current business earns her about US$20 per day to meet the family’s need.
Pharet has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is going to use her portion to buy a tailoring machine and use a portion of it to spend on buying fabric. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a 38-year-old woman who is married to Eliakim, a 52-year-old man with a huge smile. From their marriage, they have been blessed with four children, namely: Elviani, 20, who is working; Gesta, 18 years old who has just graduated from Senior High School; Ignasius, 10; and Jenikher, 9, both of whom are students at the elementary school. 

Rahel’s husband is a carpenter, and Rahel herself has been running a business selling vegetables since the age of 5. Usually she rises early to be at the market by 5 am to buy the freshest vegetables. Returning home she packs the vegetables into woven baskets, which she hangs from a bamboo pole balanced across her shoulders. She carries the produce from door to door, selling to regular clients. In the afternoon she works for a neighbor cleaning house and washing clothes before returning to her family in the evening. She also has established a business running a small kiosk in her house which she opens in between all of her other jobs. 

Currently, Rahel wanted to increase the income of her businesses, and required more cash.  However she did not have the money to do so. Therefore she requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan was used to buy a greater variety of vegetables and has added more stock to her kiosk shelves.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with six children, three of whom are in school.

Umazi has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby.  

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en:
Sivorn, 33, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chor district. She is a married mother of two children. Her family’s income is from leasing a rice paddy of 1 hectare. She has been in this business for 15 years. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 33,000 per day and managesto save about KHR 10,000 per day for the future needs. 

Sivorn is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Da is 38 years old and a mother of four kids, one is too young for schooling and three are in school. Her main source of income are from maize farming , which she has occupied herself with for 11 years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day to secure the needs of her family. 

This is the original loan for Da with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).   She teamed up as a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal is a resident of the Moung Russey district located in Battambang province. She is a 45-year-old farmer and also a mother of four children, three of them are living dependent on her. She works very hard on a three-hectare area of rice farm to earn a living and support her family. She has been involved in agribusiness for almost her entire life, 30 years until now. Unfortunately, she is able to earn only 35,000 KHR per day out of the farm. 

Sophal has been a borrower of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past ten cycles and she progressively has finished all the payment. The loan has enabled her to improve the situation of her family. Now, she leads a group of three members to apply for a loan of 3,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she plans to use her share of 1,400,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice farm. She believes that the loan will allow her to gradually uplift her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Sreymov's Group

texts.en:
Sreymov and her family are living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a 26 years old mother of a child and a typical villager who does crop farming to earn a living. She has worked her one hectare of rice farming for about 7 years already. She also works for local residents for a fee to earn extra income to support her family.  On Inaverage, Sreymov can earn 36,700 KHR per day to cover expenses for the whole family.  

Sreymov is the leader of a group of 4 members. This is the 4th time for her and two other members and the 3rd time for the other borrower to request for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The group seeks for a loan of 5,600,000 KHR which contributes to an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR to each member. Sreymov plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor fee for her rice farm. She hopes that the loan will allow her to get a higher yield from the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide & pay for labor

loans.name: Sokry's Group

texts.en: A 34-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, Sokry and her family are living in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She struggles to earn a living to support the family through cassava farming, a field which she has occupied for about ten years already. She also earns supplemental income by raising chickens for sale. This is the second and the first cycle for Sokry and her partner respectively to request a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR. Sokry will use her portion of 400,000 KHR to pay for the land-plowing fee of her cassava farm. She optimistically hopes that she will be able to improve the life of her children with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for a land-plowing fee.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Samnang, 50, is from a rural village located in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and also supplement the income by buying and selling fish-paste in the village. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day after daily expenses. 
This is Samnang’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is a second-time borrower while her co-member is just with VisionFund for one this cycle. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan and she will use her portion to buy a cow in order to help her in her farming business. She hopes to make more crops from her farmland so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to help in her farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: The Thmor Koul district of Battambang province is the home of Vanny’s family. She is a 57-year-old mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. In order to earn a living for the family, she does rice farming as do other typical villagers. She has engaged in agribusiness for about 30 years already and it has returned her an average income of 21,100 KHR per day, which is barely enough to support her children. Vanny and her partner have been borrowers of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past eight cycles. They have successfully finished the payment and it has allowed them to improve the living condition of their family. Now, the group requests for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR of which Vanny owns a portion of 500,000 KHR. She will use her share of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She strongly believes that the loan paves a way for her family to gradually uplift their living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
Seab is aged 60 years old and married. She lives with her husband and seven children in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. She has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for 42 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 
Seab is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and plow the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plow the field.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, a pesar de su avanzada edad, nunca ha dejado de trabajar para obtener sus propios recursos.
Vive en el municipio de Cereté, zona rural. Es una mujer muy luchadora que dedico gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos. Todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y construyeron una vida, sin embargo, Rosario continua con su labor de madre y aun trata de guiarlos por el buen camino.
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de alimentos congelados, más específicamente a la elaboración de empanadas.
Estos alimentos los vende crudos a los diferentes negocios de fritos, donde son preparados y posteriormente vendidos al público.
Es una mujer con mucho reconocimiento en la región gracias a su buen trabajo y gran experiencia en este campo.
Ella solicita un auxilio para la compra de insumos como harina, aceite, carne, etc.
Estos insumos le permitirán inyectarle capital a su negocio y continuar creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Even though she is of an advanced age, Mrs. Rosario has never stopped working to obtain her own resources. She lives in the Cereté municipality, a rural area. She is a fighting woman who spends a great part of her life taking care of her children. All her children are grown up and have built their lives; nonetheless, Rosario continues her work as a mother and keeps trying to guide them towards a good road. 

She makes a living producing and selling frozen food, specifically making small pies. She sells them raw to different fried food stalls, where they are prepared and then sold to the public. 

She is a highly recognized woman in the area thanks to her good work and great experience in this field.

She is requesting a loan to purchase inputs such as flour, oil, meat etc. These inputs will allow her to inject some capital into her business and continue to grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and ingredients

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom and her family, consisting of two children, are residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 26 years old and has been farming on a three hectares rice field to earn a living for about 12 years already. The average income for her family is 40,000 KHR per day. This is the first time for Sreymom and her partner to request for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The group applies for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR which will contribute to an equal share of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sreymom plans to use her portion of loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the land-plowing fee and the labor fee of her farm. She hopes that the loan unlocks a way for her family to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for a land-plowing fee and a labor fee.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Yeng is a resident from the Tbaung Khmum of Kampong Cham province. Her main source of income comes from five hectares of rice farming and one hectare of cassava plantation. This business generated her about 29,600 KHR per day to secure the basic needs in her family. This is the fifth loan for Yeng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle in a gradual way. For this cycle, she is applying for 2,200,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and seeds for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline and seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Máyela Carolina

texts.es:
Máyela se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, negocio que inicio hace 5 años cuando invirtió un poco del dinero que obtiene en su trabajo como cajera y una pequeña cantidad de dinero que tenía ahorrando. Ahora ella con su trabajo y su pequeño negocio ha logrado construir su vivienda y sacar adelante a su hijo de 8 años quien cursa su segundo grado de primaria. 
Actualmente ella no posee la capacitad económica para surtir su negocio de nuevos productos motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo para comprar productos como pantalones, camisas, toallas, trajes para niño y niñas entre otros. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de gran importancia y ayuda ya que podrá ofrecerles mayor variedad de productos a todos sus clientes y así obtener más ganancias y reinvertirlas nuevamente a su negocio. Sus principales metas son agrandar su negocio hasta lograr hacer de ello una tienda donde pueda brindarles un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes
texts.en:
Máyela has made a living selling new clothes, a business that she began 5 years ago when she invested a little bit of the money she earned from her job as a cashier and some of the money she had saved. Today, with her job and her small business, she has achieved to build a home and to raise her 8-year-old son who is in second grade of elementary school. 

Presently, she lacks the economic capacity to replenish her business with new products, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase products like pants, shirts, towerl, suits for boys and girls among others. She believes that the requested loan will be of great importance and help, because she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to all her clients, and that way obtain greater earnings and invest them in her business again. 

Her main goals are to expand her business until she can make it into a store where she can provide a better service to all clients.

loans.use: to purchase products like pants, shirts, towels, suits for boys and girls among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his house (painting the walls and repairing the ceiling).

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
Ivan es un joven inquieto y laborioso, desde muy pequeño ha estado rodeado de actividades agropecuarias y es por eso que ha adquirido cierta experiencia en este campo.
Actualmente se encuentra dedicado a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de San Pelayo. Esta actividad la inicio motivado por su madre, quien preocupada por la falta de oportunidades, quiso que su hijo se forjara un futuro y obtuviera ingresos independientes.
Hasta el día de hoy le ha ido muy bien con su actividad y aporta efectivamente dinero en su hogar.
El pide un préstamo para la compra de cerdos de cría y así poder aumentar su producción.
El ha decidido que es momento de avanzar y abrir nuevos horizontes en su vida.
Su mayor dificultad es el tiempo para estudiar y atender su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivan is an active and hard-working young man who has been involved in agricultural activities since he was a child. This is why he has experience in the field. He currently works in the breeding and sale of pigs in the municipality of San Pelayo. He started this business motivated by his mother, who was worried for the lack opportunities and wanted that his son forged a future for himself and had independent income. He has been successful until today and actually contributes to household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to buy pigs for breeding, so that he will be able to increase production. He has decided that now is the time to improve and open new horizons in his life. His biggest problem is the limited time he has to study and run the business.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Honofre

texts.en: Honofre is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 59 years old and has three adult-age children. Aside from farming he also engages in a hog-raising business to have additional income. He aims to acquire more pigs to raise but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he would like to access a loan of PHP25,000.00 to buy hog feed, vitamins and piglets to raise. Being a patient and hardworking father, Honofre believes that he will improve the business as well as his family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 21-year-old married woman who started her own tailoring business from her home. She is a hardworking Palestinian refugee who puts so much effort into developing her living. Her unique style and skill along with her university degree have attracted many customers from around her community. Zahraa hasn't faced any financial difficulties in over four years of her tailoring business. She even exclusively hires women from around the area to help her. 

Zahraa acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to purchase a new tailoring machine that increases her productivity. In the future she dreams of opening her own shop where she can display her attractive wedding and special occasion dresses.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine that increases her productivity.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is an old client in UGAFODE microfinance for the last four years, a widow, and a permanent resident of Masada in the city outskirts. She has three children and a dependent who is her niece. She has been operating two boutiques for the last 10 years. However, she faces a challenge of competition from other neighboring shops, and high rent costs. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX for 12 months, to boost her boutiques by buying more stock of ladies' clothes to sell in her boutiques. The loans she acquires from UGAFODE have enabled her to keep in business. She is also very appreciative of the financial support from UGAFODE microfinance ltd.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jabeda

texts.en:
Jabeda, 45 years old, is a rural woman from the village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Safikul, 54 years old. They are raising two grown-up sons who were deprived of an education due to their poverty.  So, they work as laborers on daily wages.  Jabeda and her husband are also illiterate and can just sign their names. They live in their own pacca house (concrete made).

Jabeda's husband owns ancestral land where he cultivates seasonal vegetables.  He has been in this agribusiness for the last 15 years. Now he has grown old and feeble, so he is unable to make the same efforts as before.  Moreover, his main challenge is capital, without which he can't grow his agribusiness.  His sons have no fixed income.  As a result, they are unable to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family. Jabeda has been engaged in her livestock business for many years.  She purchases baby goats, raises them, and then offers them for sale to the nearby markets. She has gradually improved her business and it has been a great financial help to the family.

She now wants to purchase two more goats, for which she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to offer a good, high quality lifestyle to her family.

She aspires to have a cattle herd in the future by purchasing more cows and goats.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
This is Kwekwe. She is a hardworking woman who is a widow with ten children, six of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Kwekwe has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.en:
Ananias is married with three children. He is 49 years old and lives in Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines.
 
To earn a living, Ananias is a farmer and grows rubber trees, which he has been doing for six years. He requested a loan to buy fertilizer and additional rubber tree seedlings.

Ananias has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, he hopes to produce more rubber trees in order to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rubber tree seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rukwa Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 05am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Pili's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to add to her mamalishe (food stall) and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy missing items for her food store. She dreams of renovating her work place.

Pili will use this loan with her loan group "RUKWA," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy missing items for her food store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to sew

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with six children, four of whom are in school.

Nyamvula has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. With this loan, she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Africano

texts.en:
Africano is an old client of the organization who has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 Uganda shillings. He is married with four children who attend school, and he operates as a butcher in Kambuga, which he has done for over 10 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy more cows so that he can raise money to maintain his family, pay school fees for his children and develop himself.

Africano is an honest and hardworking man but is always limited by capital. He faces many challenges like the fluctuation of prices for cows and competition from other traders. However, with this additional capital from UGAFODE, Africano is hopeful that his family's situation will improve gradually.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Paulina is a mother of five children. Three of her children are college students while the rest are working. Paulina is fifty years old and a married woman. She has been a business woman for seven years, operating a poultry project. She raises 300 to 500 chicks per one batch, and sells them after five weeks. She desires to raise up to 1,000 chicks in two rotating batches. Therefore, when she sells out of one batch, the next is near ready (in three or four weeks), and she can be flexible to meet people's demands. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. each working day and is able to make a small profit each month. 

Paulina joined the UJAMAA group with three other members for the aim of improving her poultry business and making life better. She is able to access a loan unlike before and she is requesting her first loan via Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to purchase 300 chicks, chick feed and vaccines to improve her production. Her group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase 300 chicks, chick feed and vaccines to improve her production.

loans.name: Elquin Dario

texts.es:
Laborioso y soñador, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Elquin, un hombre trabajador y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance par ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de San Pelayo.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.
El posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y de concentrados.
Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Se siente agradecido con la vida por todos los favores recibidos.
texts.en:
“Hard-working” and “dreamer” are two words that perfectly describe Elquin, a hard-working family man who does everything in his power to give his wife and children a better quality of life. He makes a living by raising and selling pigs in the municipality of San Pelayo.This is a very common activity in the region and a large part of its inhabitants do this work.

He has extensive knowledge of this work and he thinks he needs a small boost to increase his sales and enhance his business, which is why he is requesting economic assistance to invest in the purchase of pigs and pig feed. With this loan he will continue with his work, which is the only source of income for his family. He is immensely grateful for this favour.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making her bread, such as cheese, yeast, and fruit for decorating and giving flavour to her delicious products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Mariely De Jesus

texts.es: Mariely, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, con quien tiene 3 hijos, reside en  el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella lleva 15 años de tener su propio negocio de una pulpería en donde vende alimentos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, dulces, refrescos, churros, pan, productos de aseo etc. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. El préstamo que solicita es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir de más productos como ser azúcar, manteca, arroz, frijoles, refrescos y golosinas. Espera incrementar sus ganancias para ampliar su casa y el negocio.
texts.en: Mariely is 32 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has three children with her partner. She lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has had her own grocery store for 15 years, where she sells basic food items, such as rice, sugar, butter, beans, sweets, soft drinks, churros, bread, and cleaning products. This business is her family’s source of income. The loan she is requesting is for 20,000 lempiras, which she will use to stock her store with more products, such as sugar, butter, rice, beans, soft drinks, and sweets. She hopes to increase her profits in order to expand her house and her business.

loans.use: to stock her store with more products, such as sugar, butter, rice, beans, soft drinks, and sweets

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She still operates a food cafe business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food ingredients such as onions, wheat flour, cooking oil, and maize flour for her business.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase home appliances for her own house.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with seven children, only one of whom is in school.

Mwaka sells goats to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is an old client of the organization. He is married with three children and has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 Uganda shillings. He has been operating a retail shop in Kambuga district as his major source of income for six years. However, his major challenge is insufficient capital, which affects his sales and profit. 

The purpose of Julius' loan is to buy more stock so that he can compete favorably in the market. He will use his profits to pay for his family's financial needs, such as school fees, and to support his siblings and sustain his business. 

Julius is an honest and hardworking man but is always limited by capital. His dream is to expand his business so that he can better support his family. With this loan from UGAFODE, Julius is hopeful that the situation will improve gradually.

loans.use: to buy stock for his general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods like potatoes and red oil

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a widowed woman with five children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over four years, she has operated a water-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season.

With the loan, she wants to purchase water pipes and to repair a leaking tap. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and repair a leaking tap

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a 30-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Sani is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sani can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sani is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 200 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him access to the requisite high quality agricultural inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizer. When asked about how he plans to use his anticipated income, Sani said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Mahammadu, A'isha and Abunakar. Ultimately, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a 32-year-old farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Musa can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Musa, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 52 bags per hectare this season. When asked about how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona farmer, Musa said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family. Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Musa will be able to purchase the requisite farm inputs to make these dreams a reality.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Virgen Purificada De Tupac Amaru Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernarda ella es casada y tiene 58 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "“VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU”; this bank is located in the Urcos district within the Quispicanchis province in the Cusco region.

Bernarda is one of the members. She is married, is 58 years old and has 4 children. She works at her business - a grocery store and also she sells trouts. She sells staples like rice, sugar, milk and oil. Bernarda works from 8:00 A.M. until 6:00 P.M. She has been in this business for a year and it's been going very well. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She requests a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members work in crafts sales, clothing sales, grocery stores and animal sales.

Bernarda thanks via this forum those people that form part of this dream and is committed to complying with her loan payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Maya

texts.ru: Майя, 32 года , замужем, мать 2 детей. У Майи - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2006 году с 5,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию, Майя на сегодняшний день имеет: 1 дойную корову, 2 бычка. Также на земельной доли, она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет от 10,000 до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майя обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) для закупки селитры и минеральных удобрений, что позволит ей увеличить прибыль и расширить свое хозяйство, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Maya is a 32 year old wife and mother to two children. Maya - who has a high school education, is the main source of income for her family, she engages in farming and raising livestock, which she began in 2006 with 5,000 som (KGS), through dedication and hard work Maya has one cow and two bulls. Also on her shared land she grows beans for annual sale and consumption. The monthly gross income resulting from this is between 10,000 and 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Maya asked Bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) to purchase nitrate and fertilizers, which will help her increase profits and expand her farm, that will certainly lead to increasing her family's capital and will allow them to make home repairs.

loans.use: To buy nitrate and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as pepper, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 39-year-old man who is married with three children, all of whom are now attending school. He deals in the timber trade as his major source of income. He started this business in 2001 so that he could meet his family's financial needs. His major challenge is lack of enough capital, which affects his income.

Peter joined UGAFODE in 2012 to get financial assistance to complete his house since his business alone could not meet all his financial needs. He is now taking another loan from UGAFODE of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy building materials so that he can finish building his house.

Peter is thankful for Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial support that has allowed him to build his first house and sustain his business.

loans.use: To buy housing materials

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 41-year-old married man and the father of three children. His oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest one is 3, and they live together in Taiz city, Yemen. He has a university education.

Mohammed works as a teacher. Over time, he was able to accumulate a good amount of money from his salary and purchased a piece of land and built his own house on it. He has finished the building and renovation of his house, and it cost him a lot of his money. Now Mohammed plans to furnish his house, but unfortunately he hasn't got enough money to do that. Therefore he has applied for this loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for his house.

Mohammed plans to open his own institute in his area to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman with eight children, four of whom attend school, one of whom is under schoolgoing age, and three are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, cooking oil, bread and maize flour for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase salt, cooking oil, bread and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for her business. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is an old client of the organization who has applied for a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). He is 33 years old, married and blessed with four children. He lives in the Rukungiri district, where his main sources of income are in the coffee trade and from driving a car for special hire.

The purpose of the loan is to pay off the balance owing on his car. His earnings from the car have helped to supplement his monthly income. 

Leo is thankful for UGAFODE’s financial assistance in enabling him to sustain his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to pay off the balance owing on his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en: Samoeun is 61 years old. She is a married woman with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. To earn her living, she sells Khmer noodles and her husband is a village leader. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. One of her children is employed and earns approximately $6 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to purchase cement and steel to build stairs in her house. In the future, she hopes that her last child can get a high school diploma.

loans.use: To purchase cement and steel to build stairs at her house

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a repeat client of the organization who has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 Uganda shillings. He is 27 years old and married with one child.

He runs a mobile money business, which he has done for three years. He also works as an MTN (one of Uganda's largest mobile networks) agent as his other source of income. It is from these businesses that he has been able to cater to his family's needs. 

The purpose of this loan is to add capital to his mobile money business so he can earn more commission. With this loan from UGAFODE, Joshua is hopeful that his business is going to expand.

loans.use: to add capital to his mobile money business

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with four school-going children.

Mulongo sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Halima has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old single man who is financially responsible for three members of his family. He quit school at the intermediate level in order to take up a profession as a barber. He opened up his own barber shop a year ago, and after facing some difficulties when it first opened, Ali's shop is going the way he always dreamed it would. 

Ali is an ambitious man who believes in taking advantage of all opportunities. He acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy an air conditioner, a laser and a steam machine for his barber shop. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner, a laser and a steam machine for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buy flour, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.es: Emeliana es casada y tiene un hijo, ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe junto a sus familiares Emeliana sobrevive vendiendo artesanias y souvenirs y necesita un credito para comprar tela, silicona y otros materiales para fabricar sus artesanias Emeliana es por el momento la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Emeliana is married and has a son.  She lives with her family in El Alto in an adobe house.  She survives by selling handicrafts and souvenirs.

She needs a loan to buy fabric, silicone, and other materials to make her crafts.

At the moment Emeliana is the only source of income in her household, so she needs help.

loans.use: to buy fabric, silicone, and other materials

loans.name: Esther Elizabeth

texts.es:
La valentía, la dedicación y el amor por sus hijos, han permitido salir adelante a Esther, una mujer amable y trabajadora que estableció su pequeña pulpería hace un año y medio. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, está soltera y tiene tres hijos. Para ella fue todo un reto establecer su pequeño negocio, puesto que no contaba con el capital suficiente, sin embargo encontró la manera adecuada de administrarlo  y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su mercancía.  
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz y frijoles; asimismo, aceite, azúcar, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas, pastas, productos de aseo personal, entre otros. Esther deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela ganar más clientela, lo que le permitiría obtener más ganancias y así lograr estabilidad económica. Uno de sus sueños es lograr diversificar los productos que ofrece, al mismo tiempo anhela que sus hijos terminen sus estudios de secundaria e ingresen a la universidad, quiere brindarles un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Courage, dedication, and her love for her children have allowed Esther to get ahead.  She's a friendly and hardworking woman who set up her small grocery store a year and a half ago.  She's 33 years old and single, and has three children.

It was a big challenge for her to set up her small business because she didn't have the necessary capital.  Nevertheless she found a way to provide for it, and little by little she has increased her merchandise.

She's requesting the loan to increase her capital.  She needs to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, as well as oil, sugar, soft drinks, sodas, snacks, pasta, personal care products, and other things.

Esther is placing her trust in the loan because she wants to acquire more customers, which will allow her to earn more income and achieve economic stability.  One of her dreams is is to diversify her products.  She also wants her children to finish secondary school and attend college, so she can give them a successful future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, personal care products, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter and oil.

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello is a 22 -year-old farmer from Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Bello is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Bello can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Bello is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him the opportunity to purchase the requisite high quality inputs such as improved seeds. 

When asked how he plans to spend his anticipated income at the end of the season, Bello said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home. Ultimately, I want to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Denes

texts.en:
Denes is an old client of the organization who has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings. He is an older man who hails from Rukungiri district. He has two sources of income: a drink shop which he has been managing for over 20 years and some occasional farming work.

Denes is taking this loan to expand and diversify his business's stock so he can earn more income. He thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance which has enabled him to educate his children and sustain his business. His dream is to continue expanding his businesses and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks for his shop.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 40-year-old farmer from Rafin Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Gabriel is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Gabriel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Gabriel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Gabriel said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland,” and in 5 years, I want to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alh. Adamu

texts.en:
Alh. Adamu is a 65-year-old maize farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, Alh.  Adamu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alh. Adamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh.Adamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him the opportunity to purchase the requisite high quality inputs such as improved seeds.

When asked how he plans to use his anticipated income at the end of the season, Alh. Adamu said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home. Ultimately, I want to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Elizabeth Aurora

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 44 años de edad y vive en La Tinguiña junto a su familia. Es madre soltera y tiene una hija quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien lucha día tras día para darle un mejor futuro y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como obrera en una empresa prestigiosa, desempeñando su labor con mucha responsabilidad y realizando sus labores con mucho empeño y dedicación.
Elizabeth está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar los trámites para la obtención de su documento de identidad, de esta manera ella seguirá trabajando para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Elizabeth is an enterprising 44 year old woman who lives with her family in Tinguiña.  She is a single mother with a daughter whom she is very proud of and for whom she strives daily to provide her with a better future and better quality of life.

She has been working, very responsibly and with great enthusiasm and dedication, for a prestigious company for several years.

Elizabeth is grateful to the Kiva lenders because they have made it possible for her to pay for her identity card, allowing her to continue working toward achieving her greatest dream, “Having a home of her own.”

loans.use: to pay for her identity card.

loans.name: Orlin Josel

texts.es: Orlin, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro.  El inicio realizando actividades de albañilería y hace 5 años decidió por dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y lo vende en el mercado local. Se decidió por solicitar otro préstamo que es el cuarto ciclo, por el monto de 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes e insumos y pago de mano de obra para darle mantenimiento y limpieza al cultivo de maíz y lograr mejor cosecha. Su plan es ampliar los cultivos para ayudar a su familia con las ganancias.
texts.en: Orlin is 29 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage with his wife and lives in a village in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro. He began in the activity of masonry and 5 years ago he decided to cultivate and sell maize in the local market for a living. He decided to request another loan, which would be his fourth cycle, in the amount of 10,000 lempiras. With this he is going to purchase fertilizer, materials, and manual labor to do maintenance and cleaning to cultivate maize and achieve a better harvest. His plan is to increase his crops to help his family with income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies, and manual labor to conduct maintenance and cleaning to cultivate maize.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu remembers feeling depressed as a result of a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now Amadu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Amadu, is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him the resources to purchase high quality inputs such as improved seeds.  

Amadu is hopeful for the future; “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” he expressed. With this loan, Amadu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with nine school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.name: Silagi

texts.en:
Silagi is a 38-year-old client from Rukungiri district who has been operating a retail shop for nine years as his major source of income. He also carries out agriculture production for addition income. 

Silagi has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to add stock to his retail store. He has been faced with the challenge of limited capital, which he believes detracts from his ability to compete favorably in the market against his competition. He hopes with this loan from UGAFODE that he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has seven children all of whom are adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a motorcycle business.She faces a major challenge of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a 40-year-old farmer from Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Salisu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Salisu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Salisu, is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give the opportunity to purchase the requisite inputs such as improved seeds. 

When asked how he plans to spend his anticipated income at the end of the season, Salisu said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home. Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Salisu is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizer in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a 34-year-old farmer from Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Hussaini is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hussaini can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hussaini is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 55 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him access to yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds.  

When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a result of a higher yield, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a hardworking woman who is still single.  She operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.  She joined Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Darwin Mauricio

texts.es: Darwin, tiene 26 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con una hermana en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Anteriormente le ayudaba a su padre con un molino de moler maíz, y hace más de 5 años decidió tener su propio negocio  y obtener sus propios ingresos. Vende helados como cremas de vinilla y chocolate, paletas, conos, topogigios de varios sabores. La venta las realiza de manera ambulante, utiliza una hielera y en su motocicleta va ofrecer su producto de casa en casa. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar ice cream para vender. Su meta es lograr tener un local para la venta de helados.
texts.en: Darwin, 26 years old, is single and lives with his sister in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Previously, he helped his father milling corn and 5 years ago he decided to have his own business and earn his own income. He sells ice cream such as vanilla cream, chocolate, ice pops, cones, and topogigios (popsicles) of various flavors. He sells them as a street vendor. Using a cooler and a motorcycle, he offers his products from house to house. The loan that he requests is for 15,000 lempiras to purchase ice cream to sell. His goal is to manage to have a stall to sell his ice cream.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream to sell

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Caren is 38 years old and has five children who are in school.

Caren's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her dry goods business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Caren is taking out a 9,800 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Caren has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Caren would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius is a very hardworking lady who lives in the Rukungiri District of Uganda. She is 49 years old and married with five children. She works in the timber trade and has worked hard to develop her life and pay school fees for her children as a single mother.  

She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more timber. Medius is honest and hardworking but she is limited by capital. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can earn more income and provide her children with the best life possible.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 52-year-old vigorous lady and she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers.

For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Jose Fermin

texts.es: José tiene 21 años de edad y habita junto a sus padres y hermanos en casa familiar. José es un joven con espíritu emprendedor quien desde hace mucho tiempo ha logrado establecer una tienda en la cual vende variedad de productos como: huevos, maíz, frijol,azúcar, arroz, aceite, golosinas, etc. Este negocio les permite ajustar para cubrir los gastos del hogar. José ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio dado que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos y quiere contar con la mercadería necesaria para poder competir y convertirse en el preferido. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: azúcar, pan dulce, condimentos, aceite, detergente, arroz, maíz, frijoles y de más productos demandados por los clientes.
texts.en: José is 21 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in the family home. José is a young man with an entrepreneurial spirit who, for a long time, has managed to run a store in which he sells various products such as eggs, corn, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, etc. This business allows them to have enough to meet the household expenses. José has decided to invest in his business since it is one of their primary sources of income and he wants to have the necessary merchandise to compete and make his the preferred shop. For this reason, he asks for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as sugar, pan dulce, seasonings, oil detergent, rice, corn, beans and other products desired by his customers.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, pan dulce, seasonings, oil detergent, rice, corn, beans, etc.

loans.name: Navidad Del Niño Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa  de 69 años de edad soltera  y madre de  2 hijos mayores de edad, la sra. Rosa tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace unos 10 años. La Sra. Rosa  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. rosa   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada.   Se  le distingue por su chompa de color celeste, lleva una cartera sobre la mano,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 69, is single and the mother of two adult children.

Rosa has had a small business selling beauty products for about 10 years.  She has built a loyal clientele, which has generated the income to be able to cover her household expenses.  In the future Rosa would like to have her own place to sell her products and earn more income.

She's going to invest the loan in buying more cosmetics for her business so she can keep on satisfying her customers' needs and get ahead.

Rosa and all the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and the trust that has been placed in them.  Rosa's wearing a blue sweater and holding a purse in her hand.  On a parting note, she promises to meet all her proposed objectives.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a 38-year-old farmer from Rafin Tarbo, Nigeria.  As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, which is more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare--double the national average of 14. 
However, Samaila is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 45 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him access to the requisite yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a result of this anticipated high yield, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Sile, Ayuba, and Kezeya. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs such as improved seeds in order to double his yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her room (plaster the walls and purchase a bed)

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a 26-year-old farmer from Rafin Tarbo.  As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.

Like all Babban Gona members, Ayuba can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ayuba is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 45 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him the opportunity to purchase yield-enhancing inputs such as improved seeds.

When asked how he plans to spend the income from this anticipated high yield, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Joel Cortes

texts.es: Joel tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Joel es un hombre muy trabajador quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Joel es albañil y se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de huevos desde hace mucho tiempo. Este negocio es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de huevos con el fin de cubrir una mayor demanda y así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Joel is 59 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. Joel is a very hard-working man who, which much effort, has managed to get his family ahead. Joel is a construction worker and also has worked in his business buying and selling eggs for a long time. This business is what allows him to sustain his household, and so he has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in his business by purchasing a larger quantity of eggs with the result of meeting a greater demand, and thereby increasing his sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of eggs for his business.

loans.name: Christmas

texts.en:
Christmas is an old client at the organization as he is on his fifth loan with UGAFODE. He is married with six children who still attend school, and his wife is beside him in the photo. He has been in the coffee trade as his primary source of income for over 20 years. 

Christmas is affected by limited capital, therefore he decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance so that he can jump-start his business and compete even more favourably in the market. 

Christmas hopes that this loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan shillings will help him to increase his sales and earn more even profits. Christmas praised UGAFODE and Kiva for the previous financial assistance which enabled him to accumulate wealth for his family and purchase a house.

loans.use: to purchase coffee beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an oven for her food sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy cool-aid,bread etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house for the past two years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at their store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is a 40-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Barnabas is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Barnabas can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Barnabas is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season because this loan will enable him to purchase yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds.
