When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Kefas, Nahemiya, and Sunday. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income.

loans.name: Yosef

texts.en:
Yosef is a 41-year-old married man with eight children. His oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest one is six years old. Yosef lives with his family in his own house. He is an educated man with a Diploma of education. Currently he is an employee, working as a teacher in the public sector. 

Yosef is a very dynamic and vigorous man. Over time, he accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. His wife supported him with a lot of  her money. The husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses. 

Yosef and his wife built their own house on the land which they bought. But it is still not completed. As a result, Yosef is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks in order to build other rooms and complete the rest of the house.

Yosef's dream in the future is to open his own business in his area.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks in order to build other rooms and complete the rest of the house.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: Sra. Vilmar  de 62 años de edad soltera  y madre de 3 hijos, la Sra. Vilmar es una mujer muy emprendedora que gracias  a sus esfuerzos ah sabido superarse, la Sra. Vilmar tiene una pequeño negocio de prenda de vestir tanto para damas y caballeros, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más prendas de vestir  y así generar ingresos  para su posterior venta y a si también poder tener más ingresos económicos y poder apoyar la educación de sus hijos. La Sra. Vilmar se le distingue por su chompa de color negro se encuentra pa la mano izquierda al costado del caballero,ah  la vez  se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso Kiva, sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en: Vilmar is a 62 year old single mother of 3 children. Vilmar is a very entrepreneurial woman who thanks to her determination has improved herself. Vilmar has a small clothing shop for women and men, which is the only source of income for her and her family. With the granted loan she will invest in the purchase of clothing and in this way generate income by later reselling them. Also if she has more income it helps to support the education of her children. Vilimar is in the black sweater to the left of the man. She is very grateful for the support provided and says goodbye with a big Kiva hug, knowing that she will achieve her goals.

loans.use: VENTA DE PRENDA DE VESTIR

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 32-year-old married woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for three years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Raheela was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family.

Raheela felt it an obligation to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. Currently, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of threads, cloth, and ribbons along with packs of needles. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. She expects a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, cloth and ribbons along with packs of needles

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Víctor adquirió su experiencia en cría de cerdos gracias al apoyo y enseñanza constante de su padre. El aplica en la actualidad estos conocimientos para obtener recursos y mejorar la calidad de vida de él y sus padres.
Trabaja todos los días en su propio chiquero en cual alberga algunos cerdos.
Lleva en esta actividad aproximadamente 11 años.
El solicita un apoyo para comprar un lote de cerdos que le están vendiendo a precio muy favorable y desea aprovechar la oportunidad.
Con el crédito podrá aumentar sus utilidades y podrá mejorar su producción de animales.
texts.en:
Víctor gained his experience raising pigs thanks to his father's constant support and instruction.  He currently uses this knowledge to earn resources and improve the quality of life for himself and his parents.

He works every day in his own pigpen where he has some pigs.

He has done this work for approximately 11 years.

He asks for a loan to purchase a batch of pigs that are being sold at a very good price and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity.

With the loan, he will be able to increase his utility and increase his animal production.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Manzooran is a 59-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for many years. She has 2 cows for milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.  It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requested for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase two more cows. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 48-year-old married mother of two, who works from her house selling clothes to support her beloved husband, who traveled abroad seeking a better income to cover their beloved family's expenses. Khadija is well known in her region for the good quality she provides and the encouraging prices she sets.

Khadija is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with a special summer-released collection, especially to be ready for the holy month of Ramadan celebrations. She hopes that one day she can open her own clothes-selling shop, where she can expect more clients and increase her income.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special summer-released collection, especially to be ready for the holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Six years ago, Sakeena started a business selling animals. She is a married lady who has four children.  She has to bear the everyday expenses of her children so she works hard to provide continual support to her family members. Her husband is employed with a low salary income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Mileydis Elena

texts.es:
Mileydis se rebusca la vida de cualquier modo, su objetivo es poder tener los ingresos necesarios para tener una buena vida y salir de la miseria.
Ella vive en zona rural del municipio de Montería. Allí tiene montado un pequeño negocio de venta de minutos a celular y venta de frituras y golosinas.
Es un negocio muy pequeño pero tiene la ventaja de estar muy bien ubicado, esto ha hecho que sus ventas sean constantes.
Acude a un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frituras y así poder tener una amplia variedad de productos para sus clientes.
Es una mujer juiciosa y muy enfocada en sus objetivos.
Por lo pronto lo único que quiere es poder ampliar su negocio y extender sus servicios a más clientes.
texts.en:
Mileydis works things out any way she can.  Her goal is to earn the income she needs to have a good life and get out of poverty.

She lives in a rural area in the town of Montería and has a small business selling cell-phone minutes and fried foods and snacks.  It's a very small business, but has the advantage of being very well located, which has given her constant sales.

Mileydis is asking for a loan to buy a selection of fried foods so she has a wide variety of products for her customers.

She's a sensible woman who's very focused on her goals.  The only thing she wants is to be able to expand her store and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy a selection of fried foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fixed assets like seating and signage to improve the look of his barber shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elizabeth has restarted her fish-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elizabeth has taken a 8,085 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elizabeth is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct canals of fertilizer and to prepare the earth to recuperate resources lost due to the winter.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ginalyn has restarted her food-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ginalyn has taken a 9,714 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ginalyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She, along with her husband, has been doing the work of agriculture for many years. She crops different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Perveen applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assortment.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira, age 31, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 41-year-old married lady and has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees), which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy liquors and cover moving expenses and location improvements, so that he can enjoy a bigger success and continue to run the business smoothly.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Este es Orlando, un hombre humilde que en su mirada se reflejan los grandes conocimientos que tiene acerca del manejo del campo. 
Es un agricultor muy habilidoso y sabio, tiene cultivos de frutas y algunos citricos en el municipio de Santa Bárbara.
Asiste sus tierras todos los días y las cosechas obtenidas las vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y riegos, insumos que le permitirán nutrir sus tierras y tener unos productos de mejor calidad.
Su mayor sueño es tener una gran parcela y ofrecer empleo a las personas de la región.
el solo quiere ofrecerle a sus hijos una buena educacion y estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
This is Orlando, a humble man who has great knowledge that he has about managing the fields reflected in his eyes. He is a very skillful and wise farmer. He has fruit crops and grows some citrus fruits in the municipality of Santa Barbara. He tends his land every day and the harvests he obtains he sells in the market square of the municipality.

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and irrigation, supplies that will allow him to nourish his land and to have some better quality products.

His greatest dream is to have a large parcel of land and to offer employment to the people of the region. He only wants to offer a good education and economic stability to his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and irrigation.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balimaya est constitué de quatrefemmes  toutes mariées et vie dans des ménages majoritairement  monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font le petit  commerce d’habits pour enfants de meilleures qualités, de condiments et de pâtes d’arachides.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle en prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa(Femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (enfants) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 80 complets en gros. Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché.La revente s’effectue à Djalakorodji et au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The group Balimaya is composed of four women, who are all married and living for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 32 years of age and four children each, all living in Djalakorodji, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through tontines in the area and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members have small-scale businesses involving children’s clothing of the best qualities, condiments, and peanut butter. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Ms. Awa (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling children’s clothing of the best qualities. She intends to use this loan to purchase 80 outfits wholesale. She gets her supplies at the big market. Her sales are made to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Awa plans on making an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used for meeting the children’s sundry needs. The rest will be used to invest in her work. She is counting a lot on the Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goals, which include expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is fifty-seven years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. Melodia works very hard to provide for them.

Melodia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Melodia has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Melodia has taken a housing loan of PHP 9800 through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Melodia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Qnarik

texts.en: Qnarik lives in Tsater village in the Lori region of Armenia with her grandmother, mother and brother. Their family is in quite a difficult financial situation. That is why Qnarik's father has moved to Russia to support his family. The other family members hold a retail store where they sell various products. Qnarik has been engaged in the grocery business for many years. She has a very good credit history with no delinquent days. Now she has applied for another loan of USD 2,000 to purchase new products for the store. Qnarik and her family really appreciate the help of all the lenders. They hope to sustain the business and expand it in future.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in the store

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Trabajando Juntos Group

texts.es:
ESMERALDA vive en vainilla. Tiene 43 años. 4 hijos. De los cuales 3 estudian y el otro tiene ya compromiso con su propia familia. Su esposo es jornalero y tiene una discapacidad en su brazo derecho, cuya ausencia la padece desde su nacimiento. A medida de sus posibilidades el trabaja limpiando con machete fincas, huertos y patios de las casas del pueblo.
ESMERALDA tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad. Hace 5 años tiene esta tienda y está instalada en la casa en que vive. La misma que ha logrado conseguir con los ahorros de ella y su esposo.
Este es el segundo crédito con FODEMI y comenta le ha ido muy bien. Pese a que algunos de sus vecinos no le han podido pagar las cuentas que ella les dio a crédito. 
Ella recibirá $ 700,00  con los cuales comprara más productos de primera necesidad para servir más cómodamente a su comunidad.
Dice haber aprovechado en poner una tienda por lo que le permite estar más tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y así apoyarlos en sus tareas.
Sus aspiraciones a futuro son de adecuar mejor su casa y mejorar el lugar donde tiene la tienda.
texts.en:
Esmeralda lives in Vainilla. She is a 43-year old woman who has 4 children, 3 of whom study. The other one already has his own family. Her husband is a day laborer and has a disability in his right arm since he was born. He works with a machete clearing fields, gardens and backyards of village houses. Emeralda has a small store of basic products started 5 years ago in her house thanks to the savings she and her husband had been able to accrue. 

This is her second loan with FODEMI and she mentions things are going very well, even considering that some of her neighbors have not repaid their debt with her. She will receive $700 to buy more basic products and serve his community better.

She decided to start a store so that she could spend more time at home with the children and help them with homework. Her goal in the future is to make improvements to the house as well as to the space where the store is located.

loans.use: to buy more basic products to better serve her community.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for a period of about 8 years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this reason, she requires hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities so she applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 11th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school.

Wanza sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a forty-seven-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband's income is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated a business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become known for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales and ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Elizbath

texts.en: Elizbath is twenty-six years old and married. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She is an expert in stitching stylish dresses for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation. She has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Benkan sont majoritairement mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 39ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans à Sikoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font la vente d’ustensiles plastiques, d’habits et de produits cosmétiques.Dans  le dessein de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ramata(femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’ustensiles en plastiques.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 80 bols et 40 baignoires. Elles s’approvisionnent en ustensiles plastiques au grand marché.La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Ramata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Benkan are married for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 39 years of age and three children each, all living in Sikoroni, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members sell plastic utensils, clothing, and cosmetic products. 

With plans to build up their inventory of goods, the group members decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Ramata (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is a major vendor of plastic utensils. She intends to use this loan to purchase 80 bowls and 40 basins. She gets her supplies at the big market. Her sales are made by hawking, and sometime by special order, to a customer base composed mostly of women paying with cash or credit.

With this loan, Ms. Ramata plans on making an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for ensuring her children’s healthcare. Her goal is to increase her business volume through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase utensils

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Danaya sont équitablement mariés dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 39ans et 5enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sikoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font la vente d’habits (pagnes wax) et de condiments.Dans  le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ténin(femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente d’habits (pagnes wax).Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent en habit au grand marché.La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes Sikoroni. Madame Ténin compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya are married equally in monogamous and polygamous households. And they average 39 years of age and five children each, all living in Sikoroni, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members sells cloth (Wax ‘pagne’) and condiments. 

With the goal of building up their inventory of goods, the group members decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Ténin (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) has a good reputation for selling Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to use this loan to purchase 20 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. She gets her supplies at the big market. Her sales are made by hawking, and sometime by special order, to a customer base composed mostly of Sikoroni women. 

With this loan, Ms. Ténin plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for ensuring her children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase cloth (of Wax 'pagne')

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 44-year-old married woman, who has been working as a tailor from her house for seventeen years. She is a hardworker, well known in her region with the special talents and designs she provides.

Salma is working hard to develop her business and talents. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new updated tailoring machine and special summer design textiles.

She hopes that one day she can open her own clothes factory outside her house and develop her business widely.

loans.use: to buy a new updated tailoring machine and special summer design textiles.

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en:
Nzalambi appreciates her previous Kiva loan because it improved her living standards.

She still prepares food in her food stall. She is now requesting a loan to purchase onions, wheat flour, tomatoes, maize flour and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, wheat flour, tomatoes, maize flour and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon, Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a PHP 9942 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.  With your help Melanie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business and is now requesting a PHP 9,090 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Leonora will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs such as organic fertilizers, fertilizers, seeds, in order to have more productive crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, stout, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a repeat client at the branch. She is 34-years-old and married with two children who attend school. She also takes care of two orphans for whom she pays school fees. Her major source of income is a retail shop that stocks a wide variety of goods, including pharmaceutical drugs. However, her major challenges are competition and limited capital. 

Miriam is taking a loan of 4,000,000 Uganda shillings to supplement her capital so she can better compete in the market. She is very grateful to Kiva and UGAFODE for the previous financial assistance which enabled her to educate her children and sustain her business. She believes it's very important work to improve people's standards of living.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store

loans.name: Al- Amal A- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Al- Amal Al- Hodeidah is a group which consists of four women, living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Mona is the leader of the group. She is a 27-year-old married woman with six children and lives with them in a simple house in a poor area. Mona is an uneducated woman, but is a very active and dynamic woman. In order to help her children with a secure future, she decided to sell ice cream and women's clothes in the streets under the sunshine. From this business, Mona earns good profits. Unfortunately, it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. She wants to improve her business more. For this reason, Mona is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase ice cream materials and more women's clothes.

Mona looks forward to opening a shop for selling many kinds of ready made women's clothes and ice cream.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream materials and more women's clothes.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 52-year-old, married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running a business of cloth selling for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Irshad requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 31 year-old married woman. She has been in business running a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers regularly.  For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her 10th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been providing a flour grinding service in her community to contribute to the family income. She has gained three years of experience in this field, and over that time, she has become famous for providing fine quality flour. In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Rasheeda contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 55,000. The purchase of a new grinder with the loan proceeds will help her cater to more customers over time, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. Rasheeda wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: A year ago, Sakeena started a business selling cloth. She utilized an empty room of her house to sell good quality fabric to the people of her community. In a short period of time, she has become popular in her locality. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. For meeting the increasing demands of her customers, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this amount to purchase good quality fabric in different colors and designs. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality fabric in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of needles and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of needles and buttons.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont uniquement mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 31ans et 3enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font la vente d’habits (pagnes wax), du sucre et de produits cosmétiques.Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente d’habits (pagnes wax). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne en pagnes wax au grand marché.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit à Djicoroni et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Korotoumou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of four married women, all living in monogamous families. On the average, they are 31 years old, with three children. They all live in Djicoroni, a district in Bamako. They know each other as relatives and neighbors as well as through their work. The group members sell clothing (traditional colorful “pagnes” wax fabric), sugar and cosmetic products. With the goal of replenish their merchandise stock, the group members decided to reach out to Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan.

Mrs. Korotoumou (the one standing on the far left in the photo) is well-known as a vendor of traditional “pagnes” wax fabric. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 sets of wax pagnes. She stocks up at the big market. She sells for cash and on credit in Djicoroni and sometimes on special order, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Ms. Korotoumou plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 45,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover the education and healthcare costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Kalo Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Kalo est constitué de quatre femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages majoritairement monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge44ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font le commerce de, condiments (oignons, aubergines…). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa(femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (oignons, aubergines…). Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 sacs d’oignons, 3 sacs d’aubergines. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine.La revente s’effectue en comptant à Djalakorodji et à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Kalo Group is made up of four married women. They average 44 years of age and four children each. All live in Djalakorodji, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, most of them in monogamous households.

They got to know each other through tontines in the neighborhood and their money-earning businesses. The members of the group sell condiments (onions, eggplants, etc).

In order to increase their working capital, they decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Awa is the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She's very renowned as a condiments reseller (onions, eggplants, etc). She intends to use this loan to buy four bags of onions and three bags of eggplants.

She gets her supplies in Médine and resells for cash in Djalakorodji, to a clientele comprising mostly women. With this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 90'000. Part of it will be used to provide for her children's needs, and the remainder will be invested in her business.

Mrs. Awa counts a lot on this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to reach her goal, which is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of onions and 3 bags of eggplants

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is 40-years-old. She lives with her son in the small village of Sachkhere district. Maia is unemployed and her son works as an operator at the local petrol station in their village. Maia decided to start her own business, as the unemployment rate is very high and it is very difficult to have a job. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 800 GEL to a start trading business. Maia will go to Turkey and will purchase bed linens to resell in Chikha at a higher price. She plans to expand the business in future and to get orders to buy more stock. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase bed linens

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a repeat client to the organization who has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings. He is 28-years-old, married and blessed with one child. He hails from Byara in the Rukungiri district, where he has run a mobile money business for the past four years. He also works as an MTN agent as his other source of income. It is from these businesses that he has been able to cater to his family's needs.

Bosco will use his loan to purchase additional mobile money vouchers which he will resell for a profit. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to purchase mobile money vouchers

loans.name: Root

texts.en: Root is a 53 year-old married woman who has done business selling milk for a period of about 10 years. She is doing it with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She has three calves and two milking cows . She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation.  She is happily running her business with its support. Now she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves that she already has. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: At the age of 50, Razia is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys baby goats at low prices. After raising them a year or two, she sells to the people of her locality and in the local market.  She has six years of experience in this field and makes a good income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, she used her 5th loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 58 year-old widow. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is a 53-year-old woman from the small village of Sachkhere district. She lives with her husband and two children. Her son works as a security guard and gets a small monthly income, which is the only source of income for the family. Liana requested a loan to start a business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL to purchase calves. When the calves are purchased, Liana will start a trading business. This will increase the family income and with increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Liana awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Katungulu

texts.en:
Katungulu is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has netiher electricity nor piped water. She is a mother of three school-going children.

Katungulu sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a married woman. She has six children. Her husband is employed with a low salary income. In order to meet household expenses her son(also shown in the photo) started providing transportation services by using his rickshaw. He earns good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  

Currently Naseem's son needs to replace his auto rickshaw's body as well as its tires. For this reason, Naseem has applied a loan of 50,000 PKR for her son. She is positive that with the help of this loan amount her son will be able to provide better services to his customers.

loans.use: to replace auto rickshaw body and tires.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a forty five year old woman, married with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Due to hard conditions of living, Grace was unable to take care of the daily expenses of her family so she decided to start a small shop around her home area to meet at least a few basic needs from the profits generated in the shop. Like any small upcoming business, she is challenged by high transport costs and price fluctuations in the market. She is a hardworking mother who needs a loan to buy salt, sweets and sachet waragi to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sweets, and sachet waragi to sell

loans.name: Al- Noras Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Noras. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. 

This is 28-year-old Zahra. She is a married  woman with  four children. She is an uneducated woman, but very active and dynamic.  In 2010, Zahra established her sambusa (traditional food) business. She began her business because she didn't attend school because her parents didn't value girls' education. Her mother only introduced her to a business. When she got married, her husband gave her some amount of money to start the business. Unfortunately, this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Zahra deiced to sell perfumes and incense besides this business. She works seven days a week and fifteen hours a day. Zahra would like a loan in the amount of 40,000 YER from AMB. She requires a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, milk, and other materials to make lot of sambusa and to purchase various kinds of perfumes and incense to sell for her customers.

In the future, Zahra hopes to open a small shop. The loan will help her to generate more income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, and other materials

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is married woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past fifteen years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, beans, and milk for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, beans, and milk for her business.

loans.name: Maarouf

texts.en:
Maarouf is a 27-year-old single Palestinian refugee who was born and raised in a refugees camp, like most of the Palestinians living in Lebanon.

Maarouf quit school during the intermediate stages to start working as house painter to support his family in their living. Six years ago, Maarouf discovered that the camp he is living in needs a special teenagers and men clothes selling shop. Thus, for this reason he established his current shop, and is developing in a well managed way as an additional income business that goes parallel with his painting profession.

Maarouf is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. This loan will enable him to increase his business merchandise with a newly released summer collection, especially before the celebrations occurring during the holy month of Ramadan.

He hopes to expand his business widely and respond to most of his customers needs.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with a newly released summer collection, especially before the celebrations of the holy month of Ramadan

loans.name: Aime

texts.en:
Aime is 22 years old. She sells foodstuffs, and she has been in the business for the past four years. 

With the loan, Aime would like to buy more bananas and sweet potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. Aime thinks bigger when she forecasts the future of this business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk, selling to her neighbors and passersby. With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and wheat flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Thembi

texts.en: Thembi is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. For the past ten years, she has been selling goats to the general public at the market. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is applying for a loan to buy more goats for her business.

loans.use: to buy more goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is a married woman with five school-going children. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. For the past ten years, she has been selling goats  to the general public at the market. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is applying for a loan to buy more goats for resale.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Aliyu Bala

texts.en: Aliyu Bala is a Babban Gona Farmer Organization member from Kunda. Aliyu Bala stated that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is his desire to fulfill this ambition that led Aliyu Bala to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Aliyu Bala can earn up to $2,000 per hectare (about 2.5 acres) this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer harvests 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Aliyu Bala is especially ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Aliyu Bala will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Aliyu Bala will be able to access all the inputs and services he needs to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seed, in order to double the yield of his farm and his income.

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatile 44 years old. She is a mother of five children between the ages of five and eighteen. She sells clothes, and she has been in this business for the past seven years. 

With this loan, Donatile would like to buy more clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a forty-two-year-old single lady who has been running a convenience store for the last three years to cover her living needs expenses. She is a hard worker well known in her region for the special prices she sets and good quality she offers.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise by buying special summer beverages in addition to an espresso machine. This will increase her sales and attract more customers.

She is working hard to expand and develop her business in the hope of opening a wholesale trade business.

loans.use: buy special summer beverages and an espresso machine

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is thirty-one years old. She is married with three children. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past four years. She wants the loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her own hard work.

She operates a business of lending out utensils to her customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more utensils such as saucepans and trays for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more utensils such as saucepans and trays

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is sixty-three years old. She lives in the small village of Sachkhere district with her school-aged granddaughter. Elena receives a retirement pension of 150 GEL per month. She is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she cultivates family-owned agricultural land and sows maize and haricot.

Elena sells the products she harvests locally and at a good price. She has now decided to purchase a calf. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to acquire a loan of 500 GEL to purchase a calf. She will raise the calf and start producing dairy products to sell in the future. Elena awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Elzada

texts.ru: Эдьзаде 27 лет, замужем, есть маленький ребенок. Сейчас Эдьзада занимается полеводством на собственном участке мерою 3,50 ГА, где выращивает фасоль. Свой бизнес она начала с 50,000 сом в 2012 году. Ежемесячный доход Эдьзады составляет около 18,000 сом. По характеру человек очень честный, целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 21,000 сом (KGS) на закуп минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от бизнеса Эльзада собирается направить на покупку дома. В своих планах она рассказала, что хотела бы дать своей дочке достойное воспитание и образование.
texts.en: Edzada is 27 years old, married, and has a baby. Edzada has a 3.50 hectare plot where she grows beans. She started her business in 2012 with 50,000 KGS. Her monthly income is about 18,000 KGS. She is very honest, committed, and hardworking. In order to further expand her business, she turned to the bank Bai - Tushum for a loan of 21,000 KGS to buy fertilizer. With profits from her business, Elzada is saving up to buy a house. She said that in the future she wants to give her daughter a decent upbringing and education.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers to improve her business.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
A sus 28 años ROCÍO  vive con sus 3 hijos y su pareja. Quien es mecánico. Arrienda una pequeña casa en San Lorenzo. Donde ha logrado ayudarse con su pequeño negocio de ventas de bebidas gaseosas no alcohólicas.
Ella recibe una pequeña ayuda mensual por parte del gobierno nacional, el mismo que es destinado para el pago de servicio de electricidad y compra de gas domestico para cocinar.
ROCÍO con este préstamo gestionado en FODEMI,  comprará mercadería para surtir su pequeño negocio y así poder servir de una mejor manera a su comunidad con bebidas de alto valor nutricional para el lonchera  de los estudiantes escolares.
De igual manera se abastecerá de agua mineral. Gaseosas, jugos naturales y cereales.
Menciona que hay momentos difíciles y el negocio no marcha bien. Pero con el esfuerzo que se hace se puede lograr el apoyo en el estudio a sus hijos.
A futuro desea poner una tienda de abarrotes. Ella conoce a todos sus compañeros desde la infancia y decidieron trabajar juntos para de esta manera ofrecer mejoras en su barrio y en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rocío, 28, lives with her three children and her partner, a mechanic.  She rents a small house in San Lorenzo where she has her small business selling soft drinks.  She receives a small amount of monthly aid from the national government to pay the electricity and to buy gas for cooking.

With her loan through FODEMI, Rocío will buy merchandise to stock her small business and be able to better serve her community with beverages of high nutritional value for student lunches.  She also wants to stock up on mineral water, soda, natural juices, and grains.

She said she has difficult moments when things don't go well with the business.  With the effort she makes, however, she's able to support her children's studies.  She wants to set up a grocery store in the future.

She has known all her colleagues since she was a baby and they decided to work together to improve their neighborhood and the community.

loans.use: to buy nutritious beverages for student lunches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, cement, sand , etc.

loans.name: Aychurok

texts.ru: Айчурок 53 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Айчурок - среднее образование, уже после окончания школы, в далеком 1979 году, она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айчурок, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. На собственном участке, мерою 0,60 ГА, она выращивает кукурузу для откорма скота, а также помидоры и болгарский перец для личного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айчурок обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Также на часть средств построит дома печку. Доходы от кредита помогут Айчурок улучшить ее материальные и жилищные условия.
texts.en: Aychurok is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. Aychurok has a secondary education. After graduating from high school back in 1979, she began working with livestock and farming. Because of Aychurok's hard work, today her farm has two dairy cows. On her 0.60 hectare plot of land, she grows corn for fattening cattle as well as tomatoes and peppers for personal consumption. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Aychurok asked the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy sheep to fatten and resell. She would also like to use part of the funds to buy a stove for her house. Aychurok plans to use profits from the loan to help improve her finances and living conditions.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Lolo est  uniquement composé  de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 46ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (friperies) de plusieurs sortes, pagnes wax et chaussures plastiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies) de plusieurs sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2balles de friperies en gros à Médine.La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Lolo Group is made up exclusively of polygamous women, who average 46 years of age and five children each. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and got to know each other through bonds of community.

The members of the group retail various kinds of secondhand clothing, Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth), and plastic shoes. In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Fatoumata is the woman standing on the left in the photograph. She's very renowned as a reseller of various kinds of secondhand clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy two bales of secondhand clothes wholesale in Médine.

She retails in Djalakorodji, to a clientele comprising mostly women. With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 80'000, to be reinvested in her business. Her goal through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso is to purchase a plot of residential land.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Aitykan

texts.ru: Айтыкан 51 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Айтыкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки трех овец. Благодаря упорному труду Айтыкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец, 12 коз и 2 лошади. Также на своем земельном участке, мерою 1,20 ГА, Айтыкан выращивает корма для скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айтыкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков, овец и коз для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айтыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Aitykan is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Aitykan has a secondary education. As the primary source of income for the family she works in animal husbandry. She started twenty years ago when she bought three sheep. Because of Aitykan's hard work, her farm now has three dairy cows, ten sheep, twelve goats, and two horses. Also on her 1.20 hectare plot of land Aitykan grows feed for livestock. Her monthly income is about 13,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Aitykan asked the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy calves, sheep, and goats to expand her herd. Aitykan plans to use profits from the loan to further expand her livestock, and she plans to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: buy calves, goats and sheep

loans.name: Boris

texts.es:
El señor Boris posee grandes conocimientos en panadería gracias a su experiencia de 13 años en trabajando en diferentes panaderías.
Hoy en día desea independizarse y generar sus propios ingresos, considera que no hay nada mejor que manejar su propio tiempo y tener su propio negocio.
Es por esto que solicita una gran ayuda, para comprar todo lo necesario para montar un panadería como un horno industrial, un mesa de trabajo, una cilindradora e insumos para sus preparaciones, adicionalmente necesita comprar materia prima.
Por ahora todas sus ilusiones están puestas en este nuevo proyecto y asegura que pondrá todo su empeño en el manejo de este negocio.
texts.en: Boris posses a lot of knowledge about baking thanks to his 13 years of working in different bakeries. Today he wants to work for himself to generate his own income. He thinks there would be nothing better than to manage his own time and have his own business. For this reason he is requesting a substancial support to buy all that is necessary to open a bakery. He needs an industrial oven, a work table, a roller and supplies for his preparations and he also needs to buy raw materials. For now all his hopes are placed in this new project and he guarantees that he will put all his effort into the management of this new business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven, a work table, a roller and supplies for his preparations, plus he needs to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Zilipa

texts.en:
Zilipa is married with two children. She sells various items in her business. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and beans to sell. 

With the profits from the business, she wishes to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more food items from the field such potatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 55 years old and is married to Tom who also gives additional income to the family. They are blessed with two school-going children.

She has been selling dry maize for the last five years and with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family. Regina has applied for a loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya and she will use the entire loan to buy more stock of dry maize for sale.

In future she will plans to grow her business and give better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more dry maize to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old. She is married with one child aged two. She owns sewing machines as her business and she has been a tailor for the past eight years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more sewing machines to increase the quality and quantity of what she produces. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy extra sewing machines for use at her shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more cashew nuts for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more cashew nuts for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a chicken coop and to buy a large quantity of chickens to make a strong start to her business.

loans.name: Santos Danilo

texts.es: Santos, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro.  Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, pero actualmente el cultivo de maíz es lo principal, el que vende en el mercado local. Y obtiene ingresos para su familia. Ha logrado sacar buena producción mediante prestamos, actualmente solicita el quinto ciclo que es por 5,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento al cultivo y compra de semilla mejorada de maíz para la siembra. Su plan es obtener ingresos para darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Santos is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in a village in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro. All his life he has been farming, growing corn and beans. But corn is his main crop and he sells the product in the local market to make income for his family. He has manged to have good production through loans. Actually he is requesting his 5th loan of 5,000 HNL to buy fertilizer to maintain his crops and to buy improved seeds to grow corn. His plan is to generate income to provide a quality life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and improved seeds to grow corn.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is married man with two children, one in school and one underage. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ali has operated fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. He sells from home to his neighbors. He dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, he wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a serger.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is age 40. She is married with five children. She sells various items in her boutique and has been in the business for the past 11 years. With this loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, maize, and beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more rice, maize, and beans for resale.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of fish and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married and has three schoolgoing children. 

Mwanalima operates a food cafe business where she makes various foods like beans, rice, tea, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items such as maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en: Godelive is 27 years old. She is married with two children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past four years. With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas for sale

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school (the youngest is not yet school-age). She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over six years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge she faces in her business. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Mwajumbe

texts.en:
Mwajumbe is a married woman with five children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwajumbe operates a food café where she makes and sells staples like beans and chapatti (flat bread) to passers-by and neighbours. 

With the loan she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, maize flour, wheat flour, charcoal, and cooking oil for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as beans, maize flour, wheat flour, charcoal, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is still a single woman with one school-going child. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie is 37 years old. She is married with four children. She is a veterinarian and owns a veterinary pharmacy, which has been running for the past ten years. With this loan, she wants to buy more medicines for animals to sell. She plans to use the profits to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more veterinary medicines for sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking woman, married with two school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Catherine has operated a cafe business making food products such as rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat-bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as a major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of food ingredients and utensils for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of food ingredients and utensils for her business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 40 years old. He is married with five children, all of whom go to school. He owns a carpentry workshop, which he has been running for the past eleven years. With the loan, he expects to buy more wood and machines for making furniture for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more wood and machines for making furniture for sale

loans.name: Anik

texts.en:
Anik lives in Vanadzor with her husband, daughter, and three sons. She is a dishwasher and works at a restaurant in Vanadzor. As her income has not been enough to cover the living expenses of her family, Anik has always been forced to search for other revenue sources. In particular, she has been engaged in animal husbandry for about 15 years. During this period she has had a very good credit history with no overdue days. Now Anik and her family members are planing to expand their agribusiness. 

For this reason Anik has applied for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy livestock (2 cows and 100 hens) as well as animal feed. This family is in a very difficult financial situation. Moreover, only three of five family members are engaged in agricultural activities as two of Anik's sons are still very little. Let's help Anik and her husband take care of their children. They will be very grateful to all the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (100 hens and 2 cows) as well as animal feed

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia is 54-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the small village of Ozurgeti district. Lia and her husband are unemployed, but they are involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have a cow and 2 calves. Lia milks the cow every day and produces dairy products to sell locally. In addition, they have family-owned agricultural land where they grow maize. Lia and her husband are very hardworking and they do their best to ensure a good harvest. Lia decided to start a trading business and has therefore requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2500 GEL. With the received credit, Lia will purchase dishes to resell. She plans to expand the trading business in future to generate more income.

loans.use: to begin to trade dishes

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is a 28-year-old married woman from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She lives with her husband. As she can't find any stable job, in spite of her high education, she decided to start her own business and opened a taxi company. She has several employees and has her own phone line. The clients are satisfied with the service and with the prices, too. Therefore, the market demand is high and her company has a lot of bookings. 

Pikria decided to expand her activity and invest some money in it. She requested a loan to purchase additional transmitters and add another phone line. Pikria will employ more people in her business and will also expand her profits as a result of this loan.

Pikria will be really grateful for the help, as she will be better able to meet all the daily costs and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase transmitters and add another phone line in her taxi company

loans.name: Jean Baptiste
