texts.en: Jean Baptiste is 35 years old. He sells beans and he has been in this business for the past 15 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more sacks of beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more beans for sale

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en: Alphonse is 32 years old. He is married with three children. He has run a retail business for the last five years. With this loan, he wants to buy more items to add to his business such as rice, beans, cooking oil, and lotions. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, cooking oil, and lotions for sale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
This is Margret. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. Besides her tailoring business, Margret operates a vegetable stall.
 
She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of vegetables for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer, supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Oro Group

texts.es:
Jodie: Es coordinadora del grupo solidario, que conformo aproximadamente hace 3 años, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 28 años de edad,  casada, tiene 2 hijos, menores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 7 años estableció su negocio de venta de chiverías, ropa interior, refresco de frutas naturales. Solicita financiamiento, para comprar mercadería: chivería, gaseosas, jugo entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construir su propia vivienda, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, en la cual habitan 7 personas. 

Magdalena:Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos para elaborar vigorón: plátanos, chicharon, repollo. Su sueño mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Hartilio: Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería para su pulperia. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero 

Yuri: Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería para su pulperia.Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jodie: She is the coordinator of the credit group that was formed about 3 years ago. She is originally from Puerto Cabezas and is 28 years old. She is married and has two young children. In order to earn her own income, she started her business seven years ago and sells yogurt, undergarments, and natural fruit beverages. She requests a loan to purchase yogurt, soda, juice, and other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and build her own home. She currently lives in her parents' home with 7 other people.

Magdalena: She requests a loan to purchase supplies to make vigoron: plantains, pork rinds, and cabbage. Her dream is to improve her family's quality of life.

Hartilio: She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her store. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

Yuri: She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her store. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise: yogurt, soda, juice, and other products.

loans.name: Lideres De Villa Rica Group

texts.es: Elizabeth de 38 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos aún dependientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Líderes De Villa Rica” está conformada por 12 socios optimistas y emprendedores, la cual pasan a su 7mo ciclo. Elizabeth se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Tiene el deseo de mejorar y ampliar su local. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y botones. Gracias a su constante esfuerzo su negocio le va bien. El grupo “Líderes De Villa Rica” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Elizabeth se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la cuarta del lado derecho y viste polo rosado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old, married and has two dependent children.

The "Líderres de Villa Rica" communal bank has twelve optimistic and enterprising members, who are now on their seventh loan cycle. 

Elizabeth makes a living making clothing items. She wants to improve and expand her business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy materials, threads and buttons. Thanks to her constant effort, Elizabeth's business is going very well. 

The "Líderes de Villa Rica" communal bank are grateful to those who are making this loan possible.

In the photo, Elizabeth is standing at the back, fourth from the right. She is wearing a pink top.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads and buttons.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias exitosas en su vida laboral y lo coordina la señora Maritza de 33 años de edad y casada, quien se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados capitalinos, trabajo como doméstica y de estos ingresos inicio comprando frutas y verduras en menor cantidad, el día de hoy bajo su propio esfuerzo ha obtenido un pequeño tramo en uno de los mercados capitalinos donde ofrece variedad de futas y verduras, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de frutas de temporada como es mango, banano y naranja, de modo que podrá cubrir la demanda que tienen estas frutas por parte de la población y así mejorar sus ingresos. Otra socia es la señora Margarita de 64 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace treinta años, la señora Desire de 43 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace cuatro nos, y la señora Yamileth de 39 años de edad, propietaria de una mueblería en su domicilio desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
This loan group has four members who are successful in their working lives.The group is coordinated by 33-year-old Maritza. She is married and makes a living selling fruits and vegetables at one of the capital's markets. Maritza used to work as a domestic servant and, with the earnings from this job, she started buying fruits and vegetables in small quantities. Today, with her own effort, she now has a small stall at one of the capital city's markets where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. This loan will be used to buy seasonal fruits, such as a mangoes, bananas and oranges. With these items, Maritza can cover demand and increase her income. 

Another member of the group is Margarita, who is 64 years old. Margarita  has been fruits and vegetables at one of the city's most frequented markets for 30 years. Forty-three year old Desire has also been making a living selling fruits at the same market for four years. Finally, Yamileth is 39 years old and has had a furniture store in her home for five years.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, bananas and oranges.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and materials to build furniture, such as armoires and doors, that clients have ordered.

loans.name: Leon Group

texts.es:
Rebeca: Es la coordinadora del grupo, es una señora alegre y luchadora, tiene  35 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos. Su esposo es comerciante, vende de manera ambulante, helados. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, desde hace 2 años conformo al grupo solidario León. Vende ropa usada. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua: Una paca de hogar, de short y camisetas para hombres y ropa para niño, para venderlo a precios accesible en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero. 

Lissette: Elabora y vende tortillas, fritos y chiverías. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su  sueño es tener un negocio próspero.

Helen María: Vende de ropa usada.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua pacas de ropa usada de hogar y mixto. Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
Rebeca is the coordinator of the group.  She is a happy and a hard working woman.  She is 35 years old, is married,  and has two sons.  Her husband has an ice cream cart.  2 years ago she made the solidarity group Leon with the goal of improving her quality of life. She sells used clothes and is asking for financing to buy in Managua: a bale of used clothing ( shorts t shirts for men and clothes for  children), to sell at good prices in Puerto Cabezas.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

Lissette:  Makes and sells tortillas, french fries and "chiverias" .  She is asking for financing to buy business materials.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

Helen María: She sells used clothes and is asking for financing to to buy bales of used clothes. Her dream is to have a shop.

loans.use: to buy used cothing, such as shorts and shirts for men and children's clothing

loans.name: Soprimas Group

texts.es: Karen, es la coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Sopimas, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas.  Desde hace 3 años conformó el grupo solidario, integrado por 3 mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras (Eliza y Pearl, con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de chinelas, ropa interior, cosméticos, en un local que alquila en el mercado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está solicitando este crédito en PANA PANA, con el propósito de comprar más mercadería para su pequeño negocio. Su sueño es tener su propio local y tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en: Karen is the coordinator of the Sopimas communal bank.  She is from Puerto Cabezas.  The group was formed three years ago, and it is comprised of three tenacious and hard-working women whose objective is to improve their earnings.  She has a business of selling slippers, underwear and cosmetics at a rented place in the market.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in Managua.  She will sell it at affordable prices in the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  She is requesting this loan from Pana Pana in order to buy more merchandise for her small business.  Her dream is to have her own place and to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, underwear, and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a mother of three children, two in school and one adult. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over 15 years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Estrella Group

texts.es:
Xiomara: Es una mujer alegre, originaria de Waspan, tiene 40, madre soltera, de 3 en edad escolar. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace aproximadamente 6 años, con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo estableció una pequeña tienda de ropa nueva en un tramo que alquila en el mercado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua: sandalias, zapatos, ropa de niño y adultos, entre otros productos y venderlos a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es ampliar el local y ofrecer granos básicos.  

Lillian: Tiene una tienda de ropa nueva. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua: pantalones de mujer y hombre, zapatos, blusas, sandalias, entre otros productos, para venderlos a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.   

Isabel: Desde hace 9 años tiene una tienda de ropa nueva, en un tramo que alquila en el mercado de Puerto Cabezas. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
Xiomara: She is a cheerful woman, originally from Waspan. She is 40 years old and a single mother, with three school-aged children. With the aim of having her own source of income, about 6 years ago, with great effort and enthusiasm, she opened a small store selling new clothing in a stall she rents in the market. She is requesting financing to buy products in Managua, including sandals, shoes, clothing for children and adults, and other products, which she will sell at affordable prices in Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to expand the store and offer staple food products.  

Lillian: She has a store selling new clothing. She is requesting financing to buy merchandise in Managua: men's and women's trousers, shoes, blouses, and sandals, among other products, which she will sell at affordable prices in Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to have a prosperous business. 

Isabel: For the past 9 years she has operated a new clothing store in a stall she rents in the market in Puerto Cabezas. She is requesting funding to buy merchandise. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes, clothing for children and adults, among other products to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Group

texts.es:
Ermelinda: Es la coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Carmen. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida e incrementar s inventario desde hace 6 meses, conformo el grupo solidario. Es una mujer alegre y luchadora. Desde hace  3 años  estableció su pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para comprar productos: granos básicos, bastimento, verduras, papel higiénico, toalla sanitaria, sopa instantánea, entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar y acondicionar su vivienda.

Remalin:. Tiene un pequeña pulpería: Solicita financiamiento para comprar: repostería, chiverías, jabón de lavar ropa, refrescos, gaseosas, granos básicos, huevo, pan. Su sueño es tener en un local en el mercado municipal. 

Yordina: Tiene una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is the coordinator of the Carmen Solidarity Group.  With the objective of improving her quality of life and growing her inventory, she formed this borrowing group six months ago.  She is a happy and fighting woman.  Three years ago, she established her small grocery store in her home.  She is now requesting financing in order to buy products, including basic grains, kitchen staples, vegetables, toilet paper, sanitary pads, instant soup, and other groceries.  Her dream is to improve and upgrade her home.
 
Remalin also has a small grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to buy confectionery goods, snacks, detergent, drinks, carbonated beverages, basic grains, eggs, and bread.  Her dream is to have a stand set up at the town market.

Yordina has a small grocery store that she runs out of her house.  She will use her portion of the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  Her dream is to improve her house and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy products, including basic grains, kitchen staples, vegetables, toilet paper,  sanitary pads, instant soup, and other items.

loans.name: Stefany Group

texts.es:
Olga María: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, es madre soltera de soltera de 2 hijos, el mayor de  10 años, que cursa su quinto grado de primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, Desde hace 8 años vende de manera ambulante ropa usada. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para diversificar su negocio, vender también ropa nueva. Comprar mercadería en Managua: ropa para niños, camisetas, gorras y ropa interior para hombres y mujeres y vender a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto, actualmente vive en una casita pequeña de madera de tambo.

Tania Teffany: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario. Tiene un pequeño salón de belleza. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar productos de belleza. Su sueño es dedicarse también a la venta y comercialización de mariscos.

Mary Jane: Vende de manera ambulante perfumes, cremas y cosméticos por catálogo. Solicita financiamiento, para comprar productos en Managua y vender a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un local en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Olga María is from Puerto Cabezas. She is a single mother with 2 children. The oldest is 10 years old and is in fifth grade. The other is 2 years old. With the goal of having her own source of income, she started selling used clothing as a street seller 8 years ago. She is requesting her second loan in order to diversify her business by also selling new clothing. She will buy merchandise in Managua, such as children's clothing, t-shirts, baseball caps, and underwear for men and women, and sell them at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to build a house of cement; she currently lives in a small house made of wood boards.

Tania Teffany is the coordinator of the loan group. She has a small beauty salon. She is requesting her second loan to buy beauty products. Her dream is to also work in seafood sales.

Mary Jane sells perfumes, lotions, and cosmetics from catalogs door-to-door. She is requesting a loan to buy products in Managua and sell them at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to have a stall in the munipal market.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, t-shirts, baseball caps, and underwear for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning, to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups, and knives to expand her business

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school and one who is too young to attend school. She lives in her house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan, she wants to purchase rice,beans, peas, wheat flour, and maize flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, peas, wheat flour, and maize flour for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup (herbal medicine), malarial drugs, and pain tablets to expand her business

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is a single woman with no children. She lives at her own house that has piped water and electricity. 

Erika has operated a beauty salon business for the past eight months. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Cuarentitres Group

texts.es: Maila: Es una señora alegre y sociable,  originaria de Waspam, tiene  33 años de edad, casada con 3  hijos, adolecentes, que están cursando su primaria. Su esposo trabaja en una institución del gobierno central, como conductor. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos,  desde hace un año estableció una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su primer financiamiento para aumentar su inventario y diversificar su mercadería y ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes: Granos básicos, pan, materiales de limpieza, chivería. También vende desde hace un año cosméticos por catálogos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Maila: She is a happy and social woman. She is originally from Waspam, 33 years old, married, and has 3 teenage children who are in school. Her husband works at an institution of the central government as a driver. With the purpose of having her own source of income, she established a small grocery store a year ago. She is requesting her first loan to increase her inventory, diversify her merchandise, and offer new products to her customers: basic grains, bread, cleaning supplies, and snacks. For the past year she has also been selling cosmetics by catalogs. Her dream is for her business to grow in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family and so that her children can receive a university education.

loans.use: to increase her inventory, diversify her merchandise, and offer new products to her customers.

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras: Francisca, Maria Auxiliadora y Maria Emilia, que se unieron hace aproximadamente un año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. 

Francisca: Es una mujer  amable y trabajadora, tiene 44 años de edad, casada, con 8 hijos, mayores de edad. Su esposo es periodista. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace un año estableció un pequeño negocio en su vivienda de  venta de carbón, tortillas de maíz, frijoles cocidos y queso. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y establecer también una pequeña pulpería, comprar mercadería: granos básicos, pan, huevos, chiverías entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar  su vivienda, comprar una refrigeradora o mantenedora para ampliar su negocio y vender gaseosas, jugos, mortadelas, pollo y carne molida.
texts.en:
This close-knit group is made up of three enterprising and hardworking women, Francisca, Maria Auxiliadora, and Maria Emilia, who came together approximately one year ago with the purpose of gaining access to credit.  They wish to improve their lives, to be able to meet their basic necessities, to assure the education of their children, and to expand their businesses.

Francisca is a hardworking and friendly 44-year-old woman who is married and has eight grown children.  Her husband is a journalist.  With the goal of having her own source of income, she established a small business in her home. She sells charcoal, corn tortillas, cheese and cooked beans.  She is seeking financing in order to diversity her product offerings and to establish a small grocery store.  She will purchase staple food items such as bread, eggs and yogurt.  Her dream is to improve her home, purchase a refrigerator or cooler in order to grow her business and sell sodas, juices, lunch meat, chicken and ground meat.

loans.use: to purchase staple food items such as bread, eggs and yogurt, as well as charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials such as thread, fabric, and buttons to improve the supplies in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, charcoal and general goods to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: Taches

texts.en:
Taches is a divorced woman with three children who are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothing business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business.

Taches is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups and knives to expand her business.

loans.name: Ernest Kyei

texts.en:
“I am a first year health assistant student pursuing a two year certificate program as a Health Assistant Clinical. I believe that my profession will benefit my family and community because of the training I will acquire after the completion of this program. Prior to this loan facility, my Father was financing my education. I had to go out of school for two months and two week due to non-payment of fees.

I draw inspiration from my senior prefect who is currently a registered caregiver, and I admire how responsible he has grown to be in his career. In five to ten years to come I will have become a fully registered nurse and will be caring for the sick. My country is a developing country, and so we find it difficult pursuing a higher education”.

loans.use: To pay fees and hostel fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic soda and palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty.

For the first time, Ibrahim will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14, and earn up to $2,000/hectare, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.

When asked, Ibrahim said, “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Ibrahim is not thinking about just this year; he said, in 5 years, he wants to “make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: to access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Martha se dedica desde hace 12 años a la venta ambulante de tinto, bebidas y frituras, actividad aprendida al lado de su esposo y emprendida con el afán de tener los recursos suficientes para su supervivencia.
Trabaja todos los días principalmente en las horas de la tarde y la noche.
Es muy trabajadora y constante.
Tiene la esperanza de obtener un crédito para la compra de surtido de frituras y bebidas además de realizar mejoras al carrito que utiliza para transportar sus productos.
Con este préstamo podrá conservar su negocio y seguirá ejerciendo esta actividad que le ha brindado todas las cosas que tiene en la vida.
Ya que es la única fuente de ingresos de su hogar cuida mucho su negocio y trata siempre de sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman who has been making a living as a traveling vendor, selling coffee, beverages and chips for the past twelve years. She learned alongside her husband and was eager to start having enough resources to survive. She works every day, mostly in the afternoon and at night. She is hard-working and persevering.

She hopes to get a loan to buy supplies such as chips and beverages, in addition to making improvements to the cart she uses to transport her products. This loan would help her to maintain her business and to continue doing this work, which has given her everything she has in life. Since this is the only source of income in her home, she looks after the business and she is always trying to keep it going.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to improve her mobile cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanamaqui Group

texts.es: “VIRGEN DE CHAPI DE YANAMAQUI” es un grupo conformada por socios empeñosos por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Emeli tiene 34 años de es soltera con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas comida sándwiches gaseosas en el kiosco de un colegio de su localidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas golosinas e insumos para cocinar. Su mayor deseo es implementar una pequeña  bodega en su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Emeli es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste chompa ploma.
texts.en:
“Virgen de Chapi de Yanamaqui” is a group made up of entrepreneurial associates who seek to improve the wellbeing of their families. 

Emeli is 34 years old and single, with 3 dependent children. She makes a living selling of sweets, food, sandwiches, and sodas at the kiosk of a school in her town. She will invest the loan in the purchasing of more sodas, sweets, and cooking supplies. Her biggest desire is to install a small grocery store in her household. 

The group is thankful to the KIVA investors for the loan provided. Emeli is the second woman to the left, wearing a gray sweater.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sweets and supplies to cook food

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза одна из жительниц маленького городка под названием Турсунзаде. Город был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя Мирзо Турсунзаде. Для Шахнозы этот город много значит. В  течение долгого времени она с семьей живет в Турсунзаде. У нее муж и один ребенок. 
   Шахноза дома занимается шитьем и кройкой женской одежды. Она научилась данным ремесло специальной школе. И по сей день Шахноза берет заказы на шитье на дому. Такая деятельность приносит значительный источник дохода. 
   На сегодняшний день швейная машинка Шахнозы сломалась и она просит кредит, чтобы купить новую, так как у нее не хватает средств, чтобы самостоятельно совершить покупку.
texts.en: Shahnoza is one of the residents of a small town, called Tursun-zoda. The town was named after a great Tajik writer, Mirzo Tursunzoda. This town means a lot for Shahnoza. She has been living in Turson-zoda with her family for a long time. She has a husband and one child. Shahnoza is involved in sewing women's clothing at home. She learned this trade at a specialized school. And to this day, Shahnoza accepts sewing orders at home. This business yields a significant source of income. Currently, Shahnoza's sewing machine is broken, and she is requesting a loan to purchase a new one because she does not have enough money to make the purchase independently.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 57 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicad en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, como cerdos, patos, cuyes y pollos su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, también se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y se desempeña como jornalera agrícola.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Hilda is 57 years old and  lives in the district of Lagunas, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock breeding. This district is located in the Province of Chiclayo that belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

She make a living breeding and selling small animals, such as pigs, ducks, guinea pigs, and chickens. Her business is located in the back of her house. She also sells alfalfa and works as an agricultural laborer.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten livestock and to purchase compost for the maintenance of her alfalfa crop.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fattening animals.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru: Майрам замужняя женщина в возрасте 46 лет. Она добрая, отзывчивая, вежливая и трудолюбивая жена. Майрам проживает в маленьком городке Турсунзаде. Она около 15 лет занимается животноводством. Майрам сама кормит, поит и ухаживает за скотами. Она кормит животных в течение определенного времени и потом перепродает их с наценкой. Сейчас Майрам имеется одного крупно рогатого скота и решила расширить деятельность и приобрести маленьких скотов. Чтобы купить необходимое количество скотин, у Майрам не хватает денег и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется, что после увеличения поголовья скота увеличиться и доходность от деятельности, что способствует улучшению жизненных условий.
texts.en: Mayram is a married, 46-year-old woman. She is a kind, responsive, polite and hardworking wife. Mayram lives in a small town of Tursun-zoda. She has been involved in animal husbandry for about 15 years. Mayram provides food and water and takes care of livestock herself. She fattens up the livestock for a set amount of time and then resells it with a markup. Now Mayram has one cow remaining and decided to expand her business and buy young livestock. Mayram does not have enough money to buy the necessary quantity of livestock, and this is why she requested a loan. She hopes the higher livestock headcount will increase her business profitability, which would help with improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy young livestock

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым 61 год, вдова, имеет 5 совершеннолетних детей. Все дети помогают по бизнесу. У Гулайым среднее образование, она всегда в хорошем расположении духа, старается добиваться всего своими силами, умеет планировать и использовать денежные средства. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, более 39 лет назад начала свой бизнес по животноводству и полеводству. Стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 4 коровы, 12 овец и 1 лошадь. На земельном наделе выращивает картофель. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулайым обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Гулайым планирует использовать для ремонта дома.
texts.en: Gulaiym is 61, widowed, and has five adult children who help her with her business. She has a secondary education and is always in good spirits. She tries to achieve everything with her own strength and is able to plan and take advantage of her financial resources. In searching for a secondary source of income for her family, Gulaiym started a business raising livestock and planting crops over 39 years ago. Having started with 10,000 som (KGS), she now has 4 cows, 12 sheep, and a horse. She also grows potatoes on her land. In order to further develop her farm, Gulaiym applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. She plans to use the profits to renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Grupo unido, trabajan juntas y se ayudan para poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian, Directora del Comité, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace tiempo y tiene clientela del barrio que compran sus productos. Su esposo también trabaja, es Policía, por lo que de esa forma se ayudan. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Las integrantes agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group is called Grupo Unido. They work together and support each other to succeed in their work and provide to their families all that they could not have.

One of the members is Lilian, the Committee Director. She makes a living selling clothes and she has been doing this job for a while and has customers from the neighborhood who purchase her products. Her husband also works. He is a policeman, and in that way they support each other. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various clothing items for resale. This way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing so far. 

The members are thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving and that will be very helpful.

loans.use: to purchase various clothing items for sale

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru:
Дилрабо живет и работает в городе Исфара. Она учительница начальных классов в местной школе города. В выходные дни она также занимается продажей женских платков. Одновременно Дилрабо учится заочно во втором курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета в факультете "Общая экология". 
Дилрабо замужняя женщина и имеет одного ребенка школьного возраста. Она усердный человек и всегда стремится развиваться, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни. Вот и сейчас она успевает и работать и учиться, чтобы получить дополнительное высшее образование. Однако в этом году она еще не оплатила за учебу. Для этой цели Дилрабо просит кредит. Часть суммы кредита она собирается использовать на оплату своей учебы, а часть потратить на расширение своего торгового бизнеса для купли нового товара. 
Дилрабо нуждается в этом кредите и верит в поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilrabo lives and works in the city of Isfara. She is an elementary school teacher at a local city school. She is also involved in selling women's scarves on the weekends. Concurrently, Dilrabo is a second-year, part-time student of the Khujand State University, majoring in General Ecology. 

Dilrabo is a married woman and has one school-age child. She is a diligent person and always tries to develop herself in order to improve her quality of living. And now she manages to work and study to obtain another higher education degree; however, she has not yet paid her tuition this year. Dilrabo is requesting a loan for this purpose. She plans to use a portion of the loan amount to pay for her education and spend the rest to expand her retail business and purchase new merchandise. Dilrabo needs this loan and believes in your support.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition and partially to purchase a selection of women's scarves in order to expand her retail business

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a young entrepreneur from Egypt. He is married. Islam is the sole proprietor of Wemok, a business located in a cart in the hallways of the Annapolis Mall. The business is to print T-shirts with any given picture, photograph or any other image. 

Currently Islam is trying to expand and diversify his business to the Pentagon Mall in Virginia; he is looking for a $5,000 loan in order to finance the expansion to a new location of the business.

loans.use: to finance the expansion to a new location of the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to tidy up his bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to plaster the walls of the household.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Silvia de 27 años de edad es separada con 01 hija dependiente. Ella forma parte del grupo “Las Tres Marías” y está constituido por 06 socias luchadoras. Silvia junto a su familia se dedican a la preparación de repostería como tortas y pasteles. Ella tiene el deseo de contar con un local para poder mostrar sus productos ya que hasta el momento solo distribuye. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para implementar su local con la compra de sillas y un exhibidor. El grupo “Las Tres Marías” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de progresar en sus negocios. Silvia se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa negro.
texts.en:
Silvia, 27, is separated and has a dependent daughter.  She is part of the "Las Tres Marias" communal bank, which has 6 tenacious members.  Silvia, along with her family, has a business making bakery goods such as cakes and pastries.  She would like to have a store where she could display her products, because up until now she just distributes her products on her own.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan to set up a store.  She will buy chairs and a display case.  

The communal bank "Las Tres Marias" thanks the Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to make progress with their businesses. In the photograph Silvia is seated; she is on the right wearing the black sweater.

loans.use: to buy chairs and a display case for her pastries

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a realizar los quehaceres del hogar, con ella ha procreado 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos asisten a la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de él..

Juan se dedica a las actividades productivas en la agricultura, y es aserrador de madera, la primera actividad la aprendió de sus padres y la segunda lo aprendió de un amigo.


El crédito que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para invertirlo en la compra de los insumos agrícolas.
 
El sueño de Juan es mejorar y ampliar su vivienda, para dejarles darles un lugar digno a sus hijos donde vivir.
texts.en:
Juan, 42, went to school until ninth grade. He is married, and his wife does the chores around the house. With her, Juan has four children, only two of whom are in school and dependent on him.

Juan works in agriculture and is a wood-worker. He learned the first trade from his parents and the second from a friend.

The loan he is requesting from Kiva partner CrediCampo is to purchase farming supplies.

Juan's dream is to improve and expand his home in order to give his children a nice place to live.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Dúo El Carmen Group

texts.es: María, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela de su comunidad, se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, negocio en el cual invirtió el crédito, se siente muy satisfecha porque gracias a las ganancias que ha obtenido, no ha tenido dificultades para cancelar las cuotas del crédito,  anhela tener una vivienda mejor, gracias a Dios ya tiene una propiedad propia, quiere ver a sus hijos con un mejor futuro ya que ella es madre y padre para ellos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en: María is a single mother with three children, two of whom attend the local school.  She sells everyday products for a living and she invested her loan in this business.  She is very satisfied because, thanks to her earnings, she has not had problems making her loan payments.  She hopes to have a better home; thanks to God she already has her own property.  She wants to see her children have a better future as she is both mother and father to them.  She is requesting this loan to buy food items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a 30-year-old farmer from Ang/Gabas. As a Babban Gona Farmer's Organization member, Hamisu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Hamisu can earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hamisu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Hamisu said, “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home,” and in five years, he wants to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seed, in order to increase his income and yield.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина жительница северного городка под названием Худжанд. Худжанд не большой город богатый древней историей, древней не изменой культурой и высококультурными рукодельными мастерами. И Мадина является одной из тех жителей красивого города. Мадина замужем и в браке имеет двоих детей. Она более 10 лет занимается кройкой и шитьем  разной одежды. Мадина работает на дому. За столько лет она стала настоящим профессионалом своего дела. Но с сожалению на данный момент швейная машинка Мадины не пригодна для работы и не ей срочно не обходимо купить новую, чтобы не лишиться источника дохода. Ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, чтобы купить швейную машинку и Мадина надеется что с Вашей помощью ей удастся совершить покупку.
texts.en:
Madina is a resident of a northern town called Khujand. Khujand is a small town with a rich ancient history, an ancient, unchanged culture and high culture handicraft artisans. Madina is one of these residents of this beautiful town. 

Madina is married and has two children. She has worked with cutting and sewing different clothing for more than 10 years. Madina works from her home. Through many years she has become a real professional in her work. Unfortunately, Madina's sewing machine is currently not suitable for work and if she does not purchase a new one quickly, she will lose her source of income. Madina does not have enough money to purchase a sewing machine, but she  hopes that with your help she will be able to make a purchase.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 62 años de edad,  es una comerciante, su estudio académico es hasta 3º grado en la escuela, debido a que sus padres decían que del estudio no lograría poder alimentarse, ella se acompañó cuando tenía 17 años.  Actualmente, Marina vive sola junto a una hermana. 

La actividad que realiza es compra y venta de especies menores esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien compraba pollos y gallinas y  ella la acompañaba desde pequeña.  Ahora ella realiza la misma actividad. Marina todos los días sale a comprar pollos y gallinas en los cantones cercanos donde ella vive, sale casa por casa a comprar de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana los lleva a vender a la plaza en donde llegan a comprar gallinas y es donde ella los vende.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de tela para el gallinero y hacer dos rejas para tener a las aves que compra en los cinco días de la semana, ya que cuando las compra las tiene en cajas grandes las cuales no son adecuadas para tener dichas aves y la otra parte del dinero será invertido para hacer mayores compras de gallinas y poder comercializar más.

En sus planes a futuro tiene una ilusión, la cual puede hacer realidad con la ayuda de su crédito y es poder llegar a tener sus jaulas para tener su gallinero adecuado y tener más seguras sus gallinas y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito
texts.en:
Marina, 62 years old, is a merchant. She studied up to 3rd grade in school, since her parents said that studying wouldn't feed them.  She was partnered when she was 17 years.  Currently, Marina lives alone with her sister. 

Her work is purchasing and selling small animals. She learned this work from her mother who purchased chickens and hens and she accompanied her from a young age. Now she does the same job.  Every day, Marina goes to purchase chickens and hens and the nearby cantons to where she lives. She goes house to house to purchase them Monday through Friday, and on the weekends she brings them to sell in the plaza where people come to purchase hens and that is where she sells them.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of fabric for the chicken coop and to make two cages to keep the birds that she purchases five days of the week, since when she purchases them, she has them in large boxes which are not adequate for these birds, and the other part of the money will be invested in making more purchases of hens to be able to sell more. 

In her plans for the future, she has a dream, which she can make come true with the help of the loan, and that is to be able to have her cages to have an adequate chicken coop and to have her hens more secure and she knows that she can make it happen with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for the chicken coop and make two cages to keep the birds that she purchases five days a week and the rest to purchase more birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, soda, salt, eggs, beans, margarine, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a 35-year-old farmer from Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dahiru can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Dahiru is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Dahiru said, “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home", and in five years, "I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Sabiu

texts.en: Sabiu is a 38-year-old farmer from Anguwa Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Sabiu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sabiu can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sabiu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Sabiu said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland,” and in five years, "I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mustapha joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. Mustapha is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mustapha will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mustapha can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and earn up to $2,000/hectare, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Mustapha said, “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Mustapha is not thinking about just this year; he said, in five years, he wants to “make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a 28-year-old farmer from Rafin Tarbo. As a Babban Gona member, Salamatu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Salamatu can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmers’ annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Salamatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Salamatu said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Tafaoata

texts.en: Tafaoata is a 33 year-old woman with one child. She runs a small elei printing business and sells them not only to the members of her community, but also to the public in town. She plans to use this money to purchase rubber for her designs, fabric materials, fabric paint, paint brushes and olls, carved boards,  and threads for her business. She has managed to help out in meeting their family's financial obligations with the profits she gets from her business.  She hopes to save more of her profit so that she will be able to expand her business and be able to find new markets to sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase rubber for her designs, fabric materials, fabric paint, paint brushes and olls, carved boards,  threads.

loans.name: Feonuu

texts.en: Feonuu is a 43 year old married woman with five children. She runs a vegetable garden business, selling her vegetables not only to the members of her community but also to the traveling public as well. She has been operating this business for two years and wants to expand the variety of vegetables she is growing so she can get more money from her sales. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. Feonuu plans to use this money to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, shovels, spades, rakes, and gloves for her vegetable garden. Feonuu has planned to save as much as possible of her profits so that she will be able to make improvements to her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, fertilisers, shovels, spades, rakes, gloves

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Эту молодую замужнюю женщину зовут Дилрабо. Ей 22 года. Она живет в городе Конибодом с двумя маленькими сыновьями, а муж находится на заработках вдали от семьи. Дилрабо способная и умелая женщина. Она зарабатывает на жизнь своим умением шитьем. Вот уже два года как Дилрабо берет заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. Благодаря своему этому умению она помогает мужу в обеспечении семьи. Чтобы расширить свою деятельность Дилрабо берет кредит. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку, а также необходимые ткани для шитья. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
This young, married woman is named Dilrabo. She is 22 years old. She lives in the city of Konibodom with her two young sons. Her husband is a migrant worker far away from home. 

Dilrabo is a capable and skillful woman. She earns money for living through her ability to sew. Dilrabo has taken orders for sewing women's national dresses for two years already. Thanks to these skills she can help her husband provide for the family. 

In order to expand her business, Dilrabo takes a loan. She would like to purchase a new sewing machine, and she also needs some fabric for sewing. She hopes for your sympathy.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and also to purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medications and do medical exams

loans.name: Delfin Azul Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario lo integran tres socios laboriosos, y está coordinado por la  señora Heydi de 32 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos quien son motivos de su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de pescados tanto en su domicilio como en las calles de su comunidad, este negocio lo impulsó hace quince años para contribuir en los gastos del hogar, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de variedad de pescados como es pargo, filete de tiburón, langostas, camarones, filete de pescado, etc., para luego venderlo a los pobladores de su comunidad. Otra de las socias es la  señora María Elena de 63 años de edad propietaria de una mini pulpería además se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio, y la señora Rebeca, 18 años de edad vende sandalias y ropa a los pobladores de su comunidad este negocio lo impulsó desde 2 años.
texts.en:
"Grupo Solidario" is made up of three hard-working members, and coordinated by Heydi who is 32, lives with her partner and is the mother of two children who are the reason for her efforts to succeed.

She sells fish, both in her home and in the streets of her community. She launched this business 15 years ago in order to contribute to the household expenses.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of a variety of fish such as red snapper, shark fillet, lobsters, shrimp, and other types of fish, to later sell to the people who live in her community. 

Another of the members is Maria Elena, who is 63 and owns a small general store and also makes and sells tortillas in her home, and Rebecca 18, who sells sandals and clothing to the people in her community. She launched this business two years ago.

loans.use: To buy red snapper, shark fillet, lobsters, shrimp, and other fish.

loans.name: Dan'asabe

texts.en: Dan'asabe is a farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Dan'asabe is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dan'asabe can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmers’ annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Dan'asabe is ambitious and is aiming to reap 100 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Dan'asabe said, “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”  With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a small entrepreneur and Kubo Financiero’s client, and this is her story:

Norma is 40 years old, is married and has three children. She owns a beauty salon which has been open for 18 years now.

At her salon she offers haircuts, color dying, nails, plucking, hairdos, makeup, pedicure, manicure, eyebrows and eyelashes to her clients; which are mainly women. She asks for this loan to renew her working equipment, specifically dryers, scissors, irons, tongs and shampoo required in the salon.

Thanks to the effort she puts into her work Norma has achieved various goals, including building her house and furnishing it, going on vacation, renewing her car and generally enjoy a good standard of living.
texts.en:
Norma is a small entrepreneur and Kubo Financiero’s client, and this is her story:

Norma is 40 years old, is married and has three children. She owns a beauty salon which has been open for 18 years now.

At her salon she offers haircuts, color dying, nails, plucking, hairdos, makeup, pedicure, manicure, eyebrows and eyelashes to her clients; which are mainly women. She asks for this loan to renew her working equipment, specifically dryers, scissors, irons, tongs and shampoo required in the salon.

Thanks to the effort she puts into her work Norma has achieved various goals, including building her house and furnishing it, going on vacation, renewing her car and generally enjoy a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

Like all Babban Gona members, Rabiu can earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare this season from growing maize. This is more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rabiu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Rabiu said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.” In five years, "I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags, condiments, and plants among other materials.

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en: Rabo is a 60-year-old farmer from Nasarawa. As a Babban Gona member, Rabo is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rabo can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmers’ annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rabo is ambitious and is aiming to reap 80 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Rabo said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Rabo is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Thanh An 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong is 32-year-old Thai lady who lives with her husband and her two children in an old Thai traditional house left by her parents-in-law after they passed away one year ago. Her two children attend school fully, and her husband works as an officer in government, but with his small salary, her family's income almost relies on her work at agriculture production. 

Indeed, Thuong has to work very hard in the field to provide for her family. She does work such as cultivating rice, and breeding fish, chickens and musk ducks. She said that the lack of capital was the biggest difficulty she had encountered currently, but she also cared about training. 

Therefore, after the success of the first loan in the Anh Chi Em Program with a fish-breeding project, this time she continues with the second loan to buy small fish to expand her project. She believes that, with the support from the Program, which includes both finance and training, she will improve her earnings significantly and better cover the living expenses of her family.

Thuong dreams her children will have a good job when they are grown up and have a more abundant life than her. 

In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish for fish-breeding.

loans.name: Edison

texts.es: Edison: Es un hombre emprendedor de 68 años de edad, casado, originario de Puerto Cabezas. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 9 años, estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y a las ganancias percibidas, le han permitido expandirse, estableciendo una nueva pulpería en otro barrio de Puerto Cabezas.  Solicita financiamiento, para comprar mercadería para su negocio: Granos básicos, huevos, chiverías, gaseosas, pan, sopas instantáneas, jabón de lavar ropa, cereales, entre otros productos. Su sueño es construir un local para su negocio, ya que actualmente la tiene en un pequeño anexo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edison is a 68-year-old entrepreneurial man who is married and originates from Puerto Cabezas. With the objective of having his own source of income, he established a small grocery store 9 years ago in his home. Thanks to the loans granted by PANA PANA and his profits, he has been able to expand, establishing a new grocery store in another neighborhood in Puerto Cabezas. 

He requests a loan to purchase merchandise for his business: basic grains, eggs, snacks, sodas, bread, instant soups, laundry soap, and cereal, among others. His dream is to construct premises for his business since currently he has it as a small addition to his own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: basic grains, eggs, snacks, sodas, bread, instant soups, laundry soap, and cereal, among other products

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina is a 52 year-old married woman with eight children. She is a woman who knew how to sew at a young age and now wants to use this talent as a means to earn money to help out with their financial obligations.  People around her community have been coming to her to have their dresses or shirts or children's clothing made. Therefore, she wants to start a sewing business.  She has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. With this loan, Evelina will purchase a new sewing machine, fabric materials, scissors, threads, and needles for her business. She hopes to make a lot of savings from her profits so that she will be able to uplift her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, fabric materials, scissors, threads, needles.

loans.name: Suititi

texts.en: Suititi is a 25 year-old woman with two children. She runs a small fishing business where her partner does the fishing while she sells fish to the members of her community and also to the traveling public. She has been a SPBD member for more than five years and she has been able to improve the quality of living of her family since operating her small business. With this money, she plans to purchase a new fishing net, fishing equipment and gears, fishing boots for her business, timber, cement, nails for her home renovation.

loans.use: To purchase a new fishing net, fishing equipment and gears, fishing boots, timber, cement, nails

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Салима. Ей 25 лет. Она с детьми живет в городе Душанбе. Салима развелась с мужем и воспитанием детьми занимается одна. Для нее главное то, что после развода дети остались с ней. Сыну 6 лет, а дочке 4 года.
   Салима окончила 8 классов средней школы и после не большого периода времени вышла замуж и родила двоих детей. Для каждого человека развод дается не легко, но Салима не отчаивается. Она владеет ремеслом шитья национальной одежды и своим талантом она зарабатывает на жизнь. Салима на дому принимает заказы на шитье женской национальной одежды. На сегодняшний день это является основным источником дохода. У Салимы сейчас имеется проблема со швейной машинкой. Она хочет купить новую современную модернизированную швейную машинку, чтобы шить быстрее и результат работы был качественнее. Но чтобы купить машинку ей не хватает денег, и она обратилась за кредитом, с надеждой на помощь.
texts.en:
This woman is called Salima. She is 25 years old. She lives in the city of Dushanbe with her children. Salima is divorced from her husband, and raises the children by herself. The most important thing to her after her divorce was that the children stayed with her. Her son is 6 years old, her daughter is 4. 

Salima finished the eighth grade in secondary school, and after a short period she got married and gave birth to two children. Divorce is not easy for anyone, however Salima does not despair. She knows the craft of sewing national clothing and with her talent she earns money for living. Salima takes orders at her home for sewing women's national clothing. Currently this is her main source of income. 

Salima currently has problems with her sewing machine. She would like to purchase a new, modern sewing machine, in order to sew faster and get a higher quality results. However, she does not have enough money to purchase a new machine, and she applied for a loan hoping to get help.

loans.use: to purchase a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone, aged 45, is a married Ugandan male with five children and all attend school. He sells cattle and milk supplements his income. For eight years, he has been in business so as to cater to the family needs. Inadequate capital hinders his business even though he dreams of educating his children to university level.

He needs a loan to buy cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 33 year old woman with one child. She wants to start an ice pop business, selling them to the members of their community. That is the reason why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. With this loan, Lina will purchase plastic cups, a new freezer, cordial, sugar for her business. She hopes that she will be able to save some of the profits she will earn from her sales so that she will be able to uplift the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase plastic cups, new freezer, cordial, sugar

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.en:
Osvaldo is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

Osvaldo is 38 years old. He has been in a common-law marriage for 11 years and has one son. The three of them live in a house with some relatives, and he makes a living by buying and selling fish and seafood, especially fish fillets.

His business is located in market in downtown Mexico City, the most renowned market for seafood and fish. He asks for this loan to make improvements at his house, specifically to install flooring, do painting and repair some damaged walls.

With the effort he puts into his business Osvaldo, aspires to keep making it grow, and in the near future, have a bigger stand in the market.

loans.use: to make improvements at his home, including installing flooring and repairing damaged walls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household and personal hygiene items to look for new clients to make her dreams come true.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Sale is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sale can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sale is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Sale said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Sitaua

texts.en: Sitaua is a 45-year-old, single woman with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for ten years. Sitaua needs a loan to buy two large chest freezers, a hanging scale, and a new cash register machine. She hopes to save her profits in case of a family emergency. She became a member of SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy two large chest freezers, a hanging scale and a new cash register machine.

loans.name: Alh. Usaini

texts.en:
Alh. Usaini is a 50-year-old farmer from Ang/Gabas. As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Usaini is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Alh. Usaini can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh. Usaini is ambitious and is aiming to reap 20 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Alh. Usaini said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland,” and in five years, “I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Muhabbati

texts.ru: Мухаббати 22 летняя уроженка района Варзоб. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Мухаббат добрая, вежливая, духовно верующая и приятная в общении девушка. Она занимается шитьем и кройкой одежды. Она любит свою работу. Такая деятельность приносит ее семье значительный доход. Мухаббат научилась шить у своей мамы. И по сей день использует ее советы в процессе работы. Мухаббат поскорей хочет купить свою собственную швейную машинку, чтобы работать на дому. К сожалению, ей не хватает денег на приобретение швейной машинки и она решилась обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a 22 years old native of the Varzob region. She is not married and she does not have any children. Muhabbat is a kind, polite, believing and pleasant young woman. She works with sewing and cutting clothing. She loves her work. This activity brings her family a significant income. 

Muhabbat learnt to sew from her mother, and currently she takes her advice in her profession. Muhabbat would like to purchase her own sewing machine as soon as possible, in order to work from her home. Unfortunately she does not have enough money to purchase a sewing machine. Therefore she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase her own sewing machine

loans.name: Thereza

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Theresa. She is married and has 1 child aged 5 years. In 2009, Theresa established her food product (garri) business. She began her business because she did not go further with her education because there was no one to pay for her school fees. 

Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Theresa requires a loan in order to buy more food product (garri), i.e. 50 bags, and to use the remainder in transportation for resale. 

In the future, Theresa plans to build a bigger store for business expansion and to educate her child to a very higher level. She is very hard working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food product (garri), i.e. 50 bags, and to use the remainder in transportation for resale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 36 year-old Aminata.  She is married, and has two children, aged 10 and 18yrs.  In 2008, Amie established her  (Macaroni, Tomato, Mayonnaise etc.) business. She began her business because she did not further her education, as there was no one to pay  her school fees.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000.  Amie requires a loan in order to buy more mayonnaise, tomatoes, etc, for resale.  In the future, Amie plans to build a bigger shop for business expansion. She is very hard working.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more mayonnaise, tomatoes, etc., for resale

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 29 year-old Rugiatu.  She is single and has one child, aged 7yrs.  In 2013, Rugiatu established her provision shop (milk,sugar, mayonnaise, etc) business. She began her business because  after her high school education, there was no job So she decided to go into business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more mayonnaise, tomatoes, etc., for resale.  In the future, Rugiatu plans to build a bigger shop for business expansion and to get more profit. She is very hard working.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more mayonnaise, tomatoes, etc., for resale

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: This is 30 year-old Alhaji.  He is married, and has one child, aged 3yrs. In 2000, Alhaji established his Cooking Pots Production sales business. He began his business because he was trained in this business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000.  Alhaji requires a loan in order to buy more production materials for pot production for resale. In the future, Alhaji plans to build a house and to educate his child to a higher level. He is very hard-working   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more production materials for pot production

loans.name: Istifanus

texts.en:
Istifanus is a 35-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Istifanus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Istifanus can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Istifanus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 60 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Istifanus said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland,” and in five years, I want to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” 

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: John

texts.en: This is 44 year-old John.  He is married, and has two children, aged 11 and 5yrs.  In 2008, John established his cinema business. He began his business because he wants to generate more income for family development because he did not go to school.  Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000.  John requires a loan in order to buy C.D plates,  a TV and generator.  In the future, John plans to open another cinema center to get more income. He is very hard working   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy C.D. plates,  a TV and a generator.

loans.name: Fanima

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Fanima. She is married, and has three children, aged 10 and 20 years old. 

In 2009, Fanima established her food and non-food items (e.g., dried pepper, beans) business. She began her business because, after her schooling, there was no job. She decided to jump into business in order to help her husband in taking care of the home. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Fanima would like a loan, in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fanima requires a loan in order to buy more dried pepper, beans, 50 bags, etc. and use the remaining money for transportation. 

In the future, Fanima plans to build a bigger shop for business expansion. She is very hard-working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more dried pepper, beans, 50 bags, etc. and use the remaining money for transportation.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Mariama.  She is married, and has two children ages 12 and 5 years. She has one additional dependent who live with her for assistance.  In 2008, Mariama established her used clothing (Junks) business. She began her business because she did not go further with her education; there was no one to pay for her school fees. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 450,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mariama requires a loan in order to buy 10 more bales of used clothing of different kinds for resale. In the future, Mariama plans to build a bigger shop for business expansion. She is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 more bales of used clothing of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 59-year-old Ibrahim. He is married, and has 4 children aged 19,16,12, and 9 years. 

In 1981, Ibrahim established his used clothing business. He began his business because he was trained as a business man. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, he earns about Le700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000.
