Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing - 10 bales of different kinds for resale. 

He was able to develop on his newly purchased land, and now in the future, Ibrahim is expecting to become a wholesaler in the used clothing business. He is very hardworking. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: José Melchor

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, es casado en  el hogar ha  procreado 2  hijos. La esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos al cuidado de los niños, también cuida de los animales de corral como, gallinas, patos y cerdos. La primera niña tiene, 3 años y el segundo 1 mes de nacido.  Él  estudio hasta sexto grado en la misma comunidad, comenta que en ese tiempo se levantaba temprano como a las 5 de la mañana para dejarle agua a la mamá,  porque el pozo quedaba como a 10 minutos de la casa, y ella no podía ir porque tenía que hacer el desayuno para el papá que trabajaba en la agricultura y  para ir a dejar ese desayuno caminaba 30 minutos.   

José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y también al trabajo del jornal para sacar los gastos que necesitan en el hogar, para los chiquitines. Este trabajo lo aprendió del buen ejemplo  que le enseño el papá, es un hombre   trabajador. La experiencia que tiene es de 18 años de experiencia. Para ir a trabajar se levanta a las 4 de la mañana y viaja 35 minutos a pie. Haciendo en total 60 minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, dos litros de insecticidas y también pagara la tierra que cultivara.  Con el crédito mejorara porque, trabajaría un poco más la tierra, porque solo cultivaba 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo y con el crédito14,000 metros cuadrados.  
    
El cliente, antes tenía el sueño de tener la casa ya lo consiguió, hoy el sueño de él es repellarla porque es de adobe, y ponerle piso porque así protegería a los niños de enfermedades respiratorias y bacterias que tiene la tierra. Comenta que lo lograra trabajando muy fuerte y ahorrando cada día para alcanzarlo, y que Dios siempre lo ayude a ser una mejor persona.
texts.en:
José, 29 years of age, is married and has 2 children at home. His wife works doing household chores, taking care of the children, and also caring for farm animals like hens, ducks, and pigs.

The first daughter is 3 years old, and the second one is 1 month old. José studied until the sixth grade in the same community. He says that during this time, he used to get up early, at 5 in the morning, to get water for his mother, because the well was 10 minutes from the house, and she couldn't go because she had to make breakfast for his father who worked in farming. To give him this breakfast, she used to walk 30 minutes.

José makes his living growing corn and also as a day laborer to earn enough for household expenses, for the little ones. He learned this work from the good example that his father gave him; he is a hardworking man. He has 18 years experience. To go to work, he gets up at 4 in the morning and travels 35 minutes on foot, making a total of 60 minutes.

The loan that he is applying for is to buy 4 bags of compost, two liters of insecticides, and also to pay for the land that he will farm. With the loan, he will improve, because he will work the land a little more. He was only farming 7,000 square meters, and with the loan 14,000 square meters.

Before the client had the dream of having a house, and now he has one. Today, his dream is to plaster it, because it is adobe, and to put in a floor, because that is how he would protect the children from respiratory illnesses and bacteria that are in the ground. He says that he will achieve this by working very hard and saving everyday to reach his goal. And may God always help him to be a better person.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of compost, two liters of insecticides, and to pay for the land he is going to farm.

loans.name: Shatar

texts.en: Mr. Shatar, 46 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a welder at a private firm since 2013. His eldest son is a driver and renders taxi service to local people. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, looking after their children. He is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy fiberglass, foam and hardwood floor for home renovation. His family lives in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. During winter, they burn lots of coal for heating their home, so after renovation, they will emit less smoke, thus contributing to clean air effort.

loans.use: to buy fiberglass, foam and hardwood floor to renovate his home

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie has been working on their own farm for many years while her husband works as a private employee to make a living. With her income from farm produce, she was able to provide for the needs of her family.  Planning to improve the farm, she took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and to cover the costs for weeding maintenance.  Elsie hopes to increase her harvest so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is 48 years old and married.  She has eight children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. Telesia has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, material, brushes, rollers, stencils and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, material, brushes, rollers, stencils and a new cutter

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Rosanna is a woman who stands out for searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family.  Eight years ago she began helping her husband working on their own farm to make a living. She thanks God for the opportunity of having a farm as their main source of income. Based on this success, Rosanna is asking for a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer.  In the future, she wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Juliet. She is married, and has two children ages 6 and 18 years old. In 2008, Juliet established her table market business selling cups, tomatoes, mayonnaise, salt, etc. She began her business because she did not go further with her education. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Juliet requires a loan in order to buy more textiles, salt, mayonnaise and tomatoes in a large quantity for resale. She will use the remaining on transportation. In the future, Juliet plans to build a bigger shop for her business expansion to earn more profit and build a very good family. She is very hard working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more textiles, salt, mayonnaise, and tomatoes in a large quantity for resale

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 46 years old and married.  She has two children. With one child currently in school, Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.  Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft-drinks, beers, cereals, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, beers, cereals, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, candies, etc. 
Mercedita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft-drinks, beers, cereals, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wenifreda is 52 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Wenifreda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, fish, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Wenifreda has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, fish, and meat for her food production business

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cesaria requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Cesaria has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
For many years in running her general store, Ruby has earned sufficient income for the family needs and has repaid successfully her previous loan used for the business. She find ways to augment her business so as to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.To improve sales, she took  a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell
 In the future, Ruby wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Ursulina requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Ursulina has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Ursulina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en:
Adolfa is 53 years old and married.  She has four children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Adolfa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.  Adolfa has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 45 years old and married.  She has three children. With two children currently in school, Fortunata works very hard to provide for them. Fortunata runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc., to sell.  Fortunata has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, toothpaste, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. 

In the future, Fortunata would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc,. to sell

loans.name: Paletina

texts.en: Paletina is 33 years old and married.  She has four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Paletina needs a loan to buy chemicals, insect poison, a rake, a tiller, fertilizer, gloves, sprayers, new overalls and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Paletina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, insect poison, a rake, a tiller, fertilizer, gloves, sprayers, new overalls and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Moevanu

texts.en: Moevanu is a 34 year-old divorced woman who has three children. She makes and sells buns and pies in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Moevanu needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large new oven, yeast, baking powder and a large pot. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Moevanu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large new oven, yeast, baking powder and a large pot

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive is 65 years old and married.  She has six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 10 years. Nive needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, cases of chicken leg quarters, cases of soft drinks, cartons of cigarettes, box of noodles and cases of milk. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2005 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy cases of chicken leg quarters, cases of soft drinks, cartons of cigarettes, box of noodles and cases of milk

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Elena is 53 years old and her children are in school.  Ma. Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell .

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Enalyn

texts.en:
Enalyn is 34 years old and married.  She has two children. Enalyn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

Enalyn has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.  Enalyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack food, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 51 years old and married with ten children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marcela has a denture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her denture-making.

Marcela has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her denture-making.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 58 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Alicia has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Alicia has taken a PHP 5,671 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Alicia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.  She has restarted her fish vending business and is now requesting a PHP 9714 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Analiza will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ricci

texts.en:
Ricci is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ricci is 46 years old and has three children who are currently in school.  Ricci has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ricci requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Ricci has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ricci would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 37 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ludivina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, bread, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, bread, etc.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 20-year-old Isatu.  She is married, and has one child who is one year old. In 2013, Isatu established her cooking ingredients business. She began her business because she was trained up as businesswomen. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she earns about 850,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more maggie, onions, tomatoes, salt and mayonnaise to sell, and to use the remaining money on transportation. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business for a better living. She is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more maggie, onions, tomatoes, salt, and mayonnaise to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Yolanda works hard to support her family. She has an Internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her Internet café. Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her Internet café.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei is 49 years old and unmarried with six children.

She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Avei needs a loan to buy sprayers, shovels, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, gloves and a large tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Avei will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, shovels, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, gloves and a large tiller

loans.name: Jilly Maricina

texts.es:
La Joven Jilly se dedica a la venta de mercadería, vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa al centro de Honduras, tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son las personas que viven en su misma comunidad.
Jilly tiene varios años de tener su negocio, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de aretes, pulseras, cremas, perfumes, polvos, lápiz labial, etc. ya que tiene muchos encargos a través de catálogos y gracias a la calidad de lo que vende,  le permite contar con buena clientela, la mayor parte del año. 

Jilly espera que esta inversión le permita obtener las ganancias necesarias para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Mayo  2014
texts.en:
Jilly sells merchandise. She lives in the city of Tegucigalpa, in the central part of the country. Her business is located at her place of residence, and her clients are people from her same community.

Jilly has had her own business for years. She is requesting this loan to buy earrings, bracelets, creams, perfumes, make up, lipstick, etc. 

She has a lot of catalogue orders, and thanks to the quality of the products that she sells, she has a lot of customers for the most part of the year.

Jilly hopes that this investment will allow her to obtain the necessary profits to improve her quality of life, as well as that of her family. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – May, 2014.

loans.use: to buy earrings, bracelets, creams, perfumes, make up, lipstick, and others for her business.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. Rogelia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. Rogelia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jijie

texts.en:
Jijie is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Jijie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Jijie is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6,607 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Jijie has been a NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Jijie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gypsy

texts.en:
Gypsy is 23 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gypsy has a general store business in the Philippines. Gypsy requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc,. to sell.

Gypsy has been in this business for one year. Gypsy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc,. to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alma is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora works hard to support her family. Cora is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Cora requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Cora has been in this business for one year now.

Cora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old and married.  She has three children. With one child still in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.  Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, snack foods, etc., to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, snack foods, etc. Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, snack foods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en: Cleofe is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cleofe is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Cleofe requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for two years. Cleofe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Los Cesar Group

texts.es:
Mucha gente de Rocafuerte conoce a la señora Elvira. Por el delicioso babor de su morocho y empanadas que ofrece cada mañana, desde muy temprano ella prepara este tipo de comida para que los pescadores, estudiantes, profesores, padres de familia y turistas empiecen cada día desayunando algo de gran valor nutricional.
Elvira es clienta de FODEMI desde hace 2 años y ha presentado un alto cumplimiento en el pago mensual de sus cuotas de crédito al igual que todos los integrantes de su grupo.
Con el presente crédito. Ella desea adquirir la materia prima para la elaboración de estos alimentos. (harina de trigo, carne, pollo, papas, aceites). Para poder servir de mejor a mas clientes y turistas.
Dice que lo que más le gusta de su pueblo es . la calidez de su gente, amabilidad. Tienen una iglesia, escuelas, colegios, centro de salud,  pero carecen de un buen servicio de agua potable.
Menciona que no tienen alcantarillado y que los jóvenes desde temprana edad ayudan a sus padres en las faenas de pesca.
Elvira vive actualmente con uno de sus hijos y un nieto de 25 y 20 años respectivamente.
texts.en:
Many people in Rocafuerte know Señora Elvira for the delicious flavor of her morocho (a type of dense corn) and empanadas, which she offers every morning.  She prepares this type of food very early, so that fishermen, students, professors, parents, and tourists may begin each day by having something very nutritious for breakfast.

Elvira has been a client of FODEMI for two years, and she has been highly responsible in making her monthly loan payments, as have been all the members of her group. With the present loan, she wants to get the basic ingredients for making these foods, such as wheat flour, meat, chicken, potatoes, and oil, so that she can better serve more customers and tourists.

She says that what she most likes about her town are the warmth and friendliness of its people. They have a church, schools, high schools, and a health center, but they lack good drinking water service. She mentions that they don’t have a sewerage system, and that from a very early age, the young people help their parents to fish. 

Elvira lives with one of her children and a grandson, ages 25 and 20 respectively.

loans.use: to obtain the basic ingredients for making foods with a high nutritional content, such as wheat flour, meat, chicken, potatoes, and oil.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and married.  She has eight children.  Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Anita has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs. Anita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 40 year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells pies and scones in her community to earn a living. She has eight years of experience with this business. Eseta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a large pan, a new oven, pay for gas refill and buy new trays. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Eseta has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a large pan, a new oven, pay for gas refill and buy new trays

loans.name: Maria Nohemi

texts.es:
Maria tiene la fortuna de tener un restaurante en una zona muy comercial del municipio de Medellín. Es un restaurante muy frecuentado y reconocido en la zona.
Ella es una mujer alegre y sensible, con gran vocación de servicio y atención.
Todos los días abre su restaurante de 8:00 Am a 8:00 Pm
Los ingresos que obtiene son para invertirlos en el mismo negocio y en los gastos de su hogar.
Ella aspira a un préstamo para capitalizarse y tener una mejor producción de alimentos, comprando una mayor cantidad de insumos e ingredientes, adicionalmente quiere contratar un nuevo empleado para aumentar su cobertura.
Este préstamo le permitirá mantenerse vigente en el mercado y crecerá como empresaria y persona.
texts.en:
Maria is fortunate enough to own a restaurant in a very commercial zone in Medellín. The restaurant is busy and well-known in the area. She is a cheerful and sensitive woman, with a grand dedication to service and attention. Her restaurant is open every day from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. She uses her income to invest in her business and to cover her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to raise capital which she will use to increase food production, buy more supplies and ingredients, and to hire a new employee to be able to serve more customers. This loan will allow her to stay competitive in the market and allow her and her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. Avelina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, paint, etc. for her business.  Avelina has been in this business for six years now.

Avelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, paint, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jen Jane

texts.en:
Jen Jane is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers through her fish-vending business.

Jen Jane has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Jen Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenny is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Jenny has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like slippers, sandals, bags, blouses, etc. to sell.

Jenny has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like slippers, sandals, bags, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felomina is 27 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Felomina has a nipa roofmaking business in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc., for her business.

Felomina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anastacia Arbasto

texts.en:
Anastacia Arbasto is 62 years old and married.  She has eight children. Anastacia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Anastacia  requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anastacia Arbasto would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 49 years old and has four children. Anecita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Anecita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anecita has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: El Arenal. Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran cinco socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Marcia mujer emprendedora de 30 años de edad y casada, es propietaria de una pulpería, este negocio lo impulso hace tres años con ayuda de su esposo y esfuerzo de ella, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, sal, plátano verde, plátano maduro, papas, caramelos, leche en polvo, etc., con el fin de diversificar los productos ofrecidos y mejorar sus ingresos. Las otras socias son la señora María de los Ángeles de 58 años de edad propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio desde hace treinta años, Bett de 36 años de edad y comerciante de frutas en la capital, Sandra de 36 años comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Tipitapa y la señora Margarita de 28 años de edad propietaria de una mueblería en su domicilio desde hace cinco años
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 5 hard-working members and they are coordinated by Marcia, an entrepreneurial 30 year old woman.  She is married and she owns a grocery store. She has run this business for 3 years with the help of her husband. 

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy staples such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, salt, green plantains, bananas, potatoes, candies, powdered milk, etc. By diversifying the products that she offers, she can increase her income. 

The other members of the group are Maria de Los Angeles who is 58 years old and sells fruit in the capital, Sandra who is 36 years old and sells fruits and vegetables in the central market in Tipitapa, and Margarita who is 28 years old and has owned a furniture store in her home for the past 5 years.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, salt, green plantains, bananas, potatoes, candies, powdered milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repairs to her house.

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en: Tiresa is a 50 year-old married woman who has five children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages that she sells in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Tiresa needs a loan to buy chemicals, a large tiller, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade and new gum boots. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Tiresa has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a large tiller, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade and new gum boots

loans.name: Viviana Janet

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo e  hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande  en la  zona urbana de Ucupe y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, es una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores (patos, gallinas y pavos), desde hace varios años..

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Viviana is 34 years old and lives with her husband and kids in their own house in a large community in the urban area of Ucupe, she enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors. The community has varied weather. Its population works in farming, commerce and cattle.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region in Peru’s northern coast. 

For the last few years, she raises and sells small animals (ducks, chickens, and turkeys). She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 new soles to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals and that way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten small animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car for personal use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use

loans.name: Anastacia Monson

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anastacia Monson works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anastacia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Anastacia Monson has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, fish, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a business farming rice in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edna has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 57 years old and married with four children. Felicitas works very hard to provide for them.

Felicitas runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Felicitas has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bath soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

Felicitas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture and hairdressing tools to start her beauty salon.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz siempre ha tenido preferencia por el trabajo independiente y la generación de recursos por sus propios medios, es por esto que desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ropa y accesorios a través de catálogos de marcas muy reconocidas.
Siempre ha manifestado un gusto por la comercialización.
Este oficio lo inicio con el objetivo de obtener recursos para la manutención de su familia.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de un vitrina y la compra de surtido al por mayor.
De esta forma podrá atraer más clientes ya que podrá exhibir su mercancía de una forma más efectiva.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un almacén con ingresos más estables y generar empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Luz has always preferred working independently and generating resources by her own means.  This is why for four years she has been selling ell-known brands of beauty products, clothing, and accessories via catalogue.  She has always enjoyed sales.  She started this work to earn money to support her family.

She's requesting a loan to buy a display case as well as supplies wholesale.  That way she'll be able to attract more customers because she'll display her merchandise more effectively.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have a store and a more stable income and generate employment for people in the sector.

loans.use: to buy a display case and supplies for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like coffee, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like coffee, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 56 years old and has four children. Loreta is widowed and has one child who is still in school.

Loreta is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Loreta requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Loreta has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Sigue dedicada a la elaboracion de dulces de zaumerio, (que se usan para rituales que sirven para bendecir las casas y los negocios de las personas. esta es una costumbre milenaria que viene de las creencias en la madre tierra) los cuales los comercializa en gran porcentaje en los pueblos.

El credito que solicita es para  comprar azucar que es una materia prima muy util en su negocio ya que este negocio le genera buenos ingresos y quiere mantener su clientela. Los dulces de sahumerio no son comestibles; sirven para la combustion en fogatas ceremoniales.


El sueño de eva es poder tenere un taller y poder contratar gente y qe se amplie su negocio, y en el futuro darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Eva lives in her own home with her husband and children in the District of San Martin in the city of La Paz.  She continues to make incense candies, which are used for blessing ceremonies performed on people’s house and businesses.  This millennial tradition is derived from the beliefs in Mother Earth.  Her products are mostly sold in the villages.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sugar, which is the main ingredient that is essential to her business.  Her venture already generates a good income, so she wants to maintain her clientele.  The incense candies are not edible; they are used as an offering in ceremonial fires. Eva’s dream is to have a workshop so that she can hire people and expand her business.  In the future, she would like to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar for making ceremonial incense candies.

loans.name: Santa Rita Dos Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita es un grupo de  17 señoras que tienen diversas actividades, ellas son muy trabajadoras y unidas, que quieren ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Lucia es una de las personas que se destaca por su trabajo y su lucha diaria, por medio de la costura está luchando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Lucia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, y demás, y de esa forma seguir con las confecciones que viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Santa Rita is a group of seventeen women who run different businesses. They are very hard workers and are very united. They want to help their families and their loved ones by working together.

Lucia is one of the members known for her hard work and drive. By working as a seamstress, she is fighting for her family to have all the things she wasn't able to have. She says she started out with very little, but she made her way little by little and presently has a very good customer base.

Lucia is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing fabric, thread, elastic bands, buttons, and other supplies, which will allow her to keep up her work. She is grateful for this opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, elastic bands, and buttons.

loans.name: Wilfredo Manuel

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 46 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos de 14 y 20 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica alquiler de espacio para guardar cocheras y bultos de mercadería de comerciantes, cuenta con clientes fijos desde hace varios años, por lo que es conocido por la actividad que realiza, junto con su esposa se dedican  a la crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecer a sus clientes en los restaurants de su distrito.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 46 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and children, ages 14 and 20, in the district of Cayalti. It is a farming, business, and ranching community located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He rents out space for storing cars and businesspeople's merchandise packages. He has had loyal customers for several years; this is why he and his wife are well known for their business of growing small animals in the back of their home. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 nuevos soles to purchase young animals to later fatten and offer to his customers in the restaurants in the district.

loans.use: to purchase small animals and feed to fatten them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is 54 years old and married, with three children.

Mamerta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mamerta has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling mangoes.

Mamerta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Monica works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Monica is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Monica has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zoila Fanny

texts.es: Fanny es una señora alegre con su negocio y muy responsable en sus pagos, Fanny tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella juntamente con su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganaderia, Fanny comenta que empezo con la actividad de ganado desde que Fodemi le otorgo el primer credito, este nuevo credito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su negocio, comenta que su rutina diaria es de levantar a las 4 de la mañana para ordeñar sus vacas y despues vender la leche, Fanny aspira seguir adelante con su negocio y darle la educacoin a su hija de 16 años y apoyar a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Fanny is a happy woman with her business and is very responsible with her payments. Fanny is 56 years old, married, and has 3 kids. Together with her husband, she is a farmer and a rancher. Fanny mentions that she started ranching since Fodemi gave her the first loan. 

This new loan she will use to buy a cow to increase her business. She mentions that her daily routine is to get up at 4 am to milk her cows and then sell their milk. Fanny aspires to move her business forward and give an education to her 16-year-old daughter and support her 2 children.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Corazon De Manzana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE MANZANA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de slachipapas, venta de ropa, venta de colchas, taller de costura, taller de artesanía, venta de cuadros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que  hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de salchipapas (comida); da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo inicio hace varios años, al observar la amplia comercialización que tenía este producto en el mercado paceño. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de  papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se identifica la ausencia de una de las socias, la misma se encuentra en consultorio médico por ello no participó en la imagen
texts.en:
The group CORAZON DE MANZANA will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II.  The group is comprised of nine members and it is run by a board for which Lourdes is the President.  The businesses that the members in the association run are varied.  They include: hot dog & french fries sales, clothing sales, quilt sales, tailor, crafts, and painting sales.

The loan will benefit the small micro-businesses where Lourdes is a member.  She says that a year ago Pro Mujer was integrated into the group due to an invitation from a colleague that is a client of the institution.  Now she has a business selling hot dogs and french fries.  She actually began this business many years ago but was able to increase her sales by selling in the market.

This loan is so that she can buy potatoes in bulk and to eventually improve her retail space.  This work enables her to generate income so that she can support her family, since she is a single mother with three children.

When we asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training offered.

In the picture we notice the absence of one of the members, as she was at the doctor's office at the time of the photo and couldn't participate.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Marvin Alexander

texts.es: Marvin tiene 23 años de edad y habita junto a sus padres en casa familiar. ÉL es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor dado que todas las mañanas trabaja en un beneficio y por las tardes se dedica  a la tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería como: bebidas, golosinas, aceite, huevos, papel de baño, arroz, frijoles y de más productos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Marvin is 23 years old and lives with his family in their home. He is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial young man; every morning he works in a processing plant, and in the evenings he works in his store that, with a lot of effort, he was able to start. He decided to request this loan from FUSAI in order to improve his living conditions. With the loan he will invest in his business by purchasing merchandise such as: beverages, candy, oil, eggs, toilet paper, rice, beans, and more products requested by his customers.

loans.use: to buy: beverages, candy, oil, eggs, toilet paper, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Llapanchispac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Agripina, la socia continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes platos como pollo con papas, arroz con pollos entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite entre otros.
  Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de cabinas de internet, negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Llapanchispac communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Agripina is the member.  She continues with her restaurant business.  She has been working in this business for years.  It is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She makes different dishes like chicken with potatoes and rice with chicken, among others.  She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue helping her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice and cooking oil, among other items.

The other members devote themselves to businesses like internet booths, restaurant, grocery store, and selling clothes.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through the loan.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy rice and cooking oil, among other items.

loans.name: Othoniel

texts.es:
Othoniel tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su familia y sus hijos en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Othoniel, 47, is married and has kids.  He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, a rural area of Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque region.  The residents work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

He has made a living for several years raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, and chickens.  His business is located behind his house.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy animals so he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Lorlie

texts.en:
Lorlie is 47 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Lorlie and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Lorlie is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Lorlie has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her food-vending business.

With your help, Lorlie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina , a 54-year-old widowed mother of three, has been earning a living by growing rice for the past year. She also earns income from a general store.

Sabina is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Olga Sofia

texts.es: Dicen que la sonrisa es la llave del corazón y es esta la estrategia que usa la señora Olga para realizar sus ventas pues anda es mejor que un vendedor sonriente y que se le note las ganas y el placer al atender una persona, Olga es una mujer de tan solo 26 años de edad la cual se desempeña como distribuidora de carne, comprando los animales y los prepara y ella misma hace los cortos actividad que inicio ante la necesidad de generar recursos para mantenerse y colaborar en su hogar. Solicita un crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo comprando animales como terneros y cerdos para seguir operando y ampliar su oferta a mas persona pues tienes todas las cualidades para abarcar un gran número de persona pero sobretodo tiene las ganas y el carisma que lo podemos ver reflejados en su gran sonrisa la cual tiene por sueño mejorar sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: They say that a smile is the key to the heart, and that is the strategy that Olga uses to make her sales. It is better to see a sales person smiling and with noticeable enthusiasm, pleased to serve people. Olga is a woman who is only 26. She works as a meat distributor. She buys the animals and prepares them, butchering them herself. She started this activity out of a need to generate resources to support herself and help out at home. She is asking or a loan to increase her working capital to buy animals like calves and pigs to keep operating and to widen her customer base. She has the ability to serve a lot of people, but above all she has the enthusiasm and the charisma.  We can see it reflected in her smile. Her dream is to improve her income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals like calves and pigs to keep operating her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs in order to have enough for her customers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years. Teresita earns more income from food vending.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erney Jose

texts.es: 10 años de su vida fueron los que invirtió el señor Erney en constituir y afianzar  su negocio de venta de calzado, un negocio que lo ha forjado con esfuerzo y trabajo duro y es por esta razón que gracias a su empeño y su excelente trato de los clientes tiene dos puntos de venta por lo que ha podido brindar un trabajo y en fechas especiales contrata más personas para abarcar la demanda de clientes que llegan a su local y en base a su experiencia sabe que la mejor manera de progresar y perdurar en el tiempo es tener rotación constante de sus productos y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito el cual empleara en comprar mercancía para surtir sus dos locales ofreciendo mayor variedad a su clientes y buscando atraer clientes nuevos para seguir creciendo como empresa y en un futuro genera más empleo ayudando a personas de bajo recursos con una oportunidad laboral.
texts.en:
Sr. Erney has invested 10 years of his life into establishing and strengthening his business of selling shoes, a venture that was forged through effort and hard work. As a result of his commitment and excellent customer service, he has two sales outlets where he has been able to provide jobs. On special dates, he hires more people in order to cover the customer demand in his shops. Based on his experience over time, Erney knows that the best way to make progress is to encourage constant product turnover. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise to restock his two shops. By offering a wider variety and attracting new customers, he can continue to grow his business.

In the future, he would like to create more jobs so that he can help low-income people by providing employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes to restock his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
Dios con Nosotros está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando por mejorar.
Una de ellas es la señora Lidia quien se está capacitando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de ingresos, y para poder tener una mejor administración de sus finanzas. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, que con mucho sacrificio hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que quiere pode crecer para dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para comprar prendas variadas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar su vida y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dios con Nosotros [God is with us] group is in its 2nd loan cycle with the Women's Committee's program. They are participating in a survey on the eradication of poverty. Three of the 17 women in this group live under the poverty line, which means that more work needs to be done to improve. 

Lidia is one of these women, and she is receiving training to improve her financial situation and to better manage her finances. She earns a living by selling a variety of clothing, which she does every day, with much sacrifice, starting early in the morning. She is a hardworking and determined woman who wants to be able to grow and provide her family with everything she was not able to have. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing, as this will allow her to continue selling, and working to improve her life and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES DE HUAYANAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ana Melva se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “LOS ANGELES DE HUAYANAY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which is in the province of La Convención in the state of Cuzco. 

Ana Melva has a business selling food. She makes different dishes like roasted chicken, soups, and meat stir fries. She works from 8am until 6pm.  She has had this business for 8 years and it is going well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde actualmente están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y posteriormente se trabajará con ellas con la metodología del Semáforo.
La Sra. Saturnina, una de las integrantes solicitó este préstamo para la compra de insumos, como ser carne, harina, huevos, aceite, otros, ya que ella está emprendiendo una nueva actividad, que es la venta de comidas rápidas, minutas, para que pueda generar ingresos en la familia, gracias al apoyo que le brindará la institución, se está animando a emprender esta actividad, para su crecimiento personal y profesional. En la foto del grupo aparecen 17 mujeres, ya que este grupo tiene 17 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo 15 solicitan este préstamo.
texts.en:
This group called San Cayetano is in its first semester of the women's committee program. They are currently doing the poverty elimination questionnaire, and then they will work with the Traffic Light methodology.

Saturnina, one of the members, applied for this loan to buy inputs like meat, flour, eggs, oil, and other things. She is starting a new business selling fast food and short-order food, so that she can generate income for her family.

Thanks to the help that the institution will provide, she is getting excited to launch her business, for her personal and professional growth. There are 17 women in this photo because the group has 17 members, but there are only 15 members requesting a loan in this cycle.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, eggs, oil, and other things.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia owns and operates a retail store in her village to make a living. With her income, she has provided for the needs of her family, begun a swine-fattening business, and repaid successfully her previous loans, which she used to buy additional inventory goods for her retail store. 

To boost her pigs, she took a new loan to purchase feeding supplies.

Lydia plans to use her newly generated revenue from the business to add to her working capital to expand her business.

In the future, she wants to renovate her house to improve the living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for her pig-fattening business.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
"If others can do it, why can't I?" This is Ivy's motto. In order to provide a better living for her child and her family, she is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at the university. 

Earlier this year, Ivy joined GDMPC and now has requested a loan to pay her tuition fee for the first semester. She wants to become successful someday, and she thanks GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil has been operating  a service based business, providing transportation in his community to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years, and has sustained the business as well as providing for the needs of his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for vehicle repair. To maintain better services, he took a new loan recently to buy a new set of tires. 

In the future, Ramil wants to provide his children with an education to bring success to their lives.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
For the past six years, Sheila has owned and operated a retail store at home to earn a living. This venture sustains the needs of her family. 

Having repaid her previous loan that she used to purchase additional inventory, Sheila has requested a new one to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes for further improvement of her enterprise to gain more income.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an electrical appliance (refrigerator and a living room set)

loans.name: Jose Eligio

texts.es:
José Eligio tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos en el Distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Eligio is 56 years old and married. He lives with his wife and kids in the district of Oyotun, in a rural area where the population works in farming, cattle raising and commerce. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru.
Jose works raising and selling animals such as ducks, cocks, hens and chickens. He has done this for several years. His business is located on the back of his house. He has asked the partner institution, Edpyme Alternativa, for a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals and in that way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Luis Diomenes

texts.es:
Luis Diomenes tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y su menor hija de 18 años en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante su mototaxi, también se desempeña como chofer de cosechadora de arroz, cuenta con clientela reconocida de la zona y caseríos aledaños, su esposa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cuenta con clientela por la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo que le permita seguir brindando este servicio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Diomenes is 41 years old. He lives with his life partner and their youngest daughter, who is 18 years old. They live in the district of Pucará, a community with a warm climate whose population dedicates itself to agriculture, commerce and cattle. It is located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region, in the mountains in the northern part of Perú.

Luis offers transportation services to passengers in his motortaxi. He also transports harvested rice and counts on well-known clients in his zone and in neighboring areas. His wife sells beauty products and also has clients in the area.

He has requested this loan of 3,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase spare parts to make improvements to his vehicle in order to improve his earning potential.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angelie is 29 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Angelie has a banana farming business in the Philippines. Angelie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angelie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Angelie would like to save enough money to be able afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Roepchand

texts.en: Roepchand thanks all Kiva Lenders for helping him to expand his rice production.  He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders on time.  He was also able to save some money for the education of his child and for the future of his family. He approaches Seva MFI and Kiva lenders for another loan of SRD 10,000.  This will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to continue production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia se formó en la ciudad de Asunción, es un grupo numeroso que se unió para poder crecer y trabajar juntas, son muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fanni, quien se dedica a la venta de mercería, donde tiene todo tipo de productos para vender, y con lo cual saca adelante a su familia. Comenta que tiene buena variedad y que eso hace que tenga mucha clientela, lo cual le ayuda mucho.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos de mercería, como ser prendas, artículos de bazar, calzados y demás, agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia was formed in the city of Asunción.  It's a large group that came together in order to grow and work together.  They are very hard-working and, above all, determined.

One of the members is a woman named Fanni, who makes a living selling sewing supplies, where she has all types of products for sale and with which she supports her family.  She mentions that it has a good variety and that makes her have many customers, which helps her a lot.

This woman is requesting this loan in order to buy sewing supplies, such as clothing, stationary shop items, footwear and so on. She says thanks for the opportunity that she is receiving, and that it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy clothing, stationary shop items, footwear and so on.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Argie is 17 years old and the second of four children in the family. His mother Angelita, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her buy and sell business in the Philippines.


Argie is currently in the second year of a four-year course leading to a Bachelor of Science in Marine Engineering. Angelita is requesting a loan of PHP 6500 to help pay his first semester tuition fees.

Argie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fe is 40 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Fe has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.  Fe has been in this business for seven years.

 In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a farming-vegetables business in the Philippines.

Felicidad requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Felicidad has been in this business for seven years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Felicidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gen

texts.en:
Gen is very thankful to Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice cultivation. 

He has repaid this loan fully and on time to Kiva lenders.  With the profits of this loan he was able to save some money for a new field, but this amount was not enough!

He wants more help from Kiva lenders and Seva MFI so he can save enough to buy another field to plant rice. He is requesting another loan of SRD 7,500 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 47 years old, married and lives at Bangkal, Aguada Ozamiz City, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  Based on a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage so as to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his mototaxi

loans.name: Leleth

texts.en:
Leleth is 40 years old, and has three children. Leleth is married, and has two children who are currently in school.

Leleth is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Leleth requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.  Leleth has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leleth would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth is a 32-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For the past seven years, Jeaneth has run a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as bread, cereals, detergent soap, coffee, salt, biscuits, etc. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional such items.

In the future, Jeaneth would like to save enough money to send her children to university.
