loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, cereals, detergent soap, coffee, salt, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Jocelyn has a native hat-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old and widowed, with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming vegetables for 42 years and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 62 years old and married with ten children. With one child still in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods, soy sauce, noodles, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc. to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soy sauce, noodles, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc. 

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods, soy sauce, noodles, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs for livestock.

loans.name: Vilma Dinorah

texts.es: Vilma tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija y su nieto. Vilma es una mujer increíble quien se dedica  a la elaboración de productos en barro como: comales, jarrones, ollas, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 45-year old woman who lives in her own house with her daughter and grandson. She is an incredible woman who makes clay products, such as hotplates, vases, pots, etc. This is how she makes a living and supports her household. 

She has decided to request a loan to FUSAI and improve her housing conditions by repairing the damaged ceiling. She will use the loan to buy galvanized layers, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized layers, wood and nails to repair the ceiling of her house.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is married with four children. Desideria is 56 years old, and lives in Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City.

Desideria sells food such as viands to earn for a living, and has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy meat, rice and ingredients and stocks for her carinderia and sari-sari store.

Desideria has been a member of PMPC for more than five years. In the future, Desideria hopes to expand her little restaurant, to progress and turn it into a famous restaurant in the city.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, meat and stocks for her carinderia and sari sari store.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio is 60 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single, with three children now at their school age. 

Elpedio has been engaged in a hog-raising activity for three years already and he earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also working as a furniture-carver in one of the furniture shops in this town. 

He has requested a loan to be used to purchase one additional piglet and sacks of feed for his existing business. Elpedio has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. 

In the future, Elpedio hopes to expand his hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase one additional piglet and sacks of feed.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Madel has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from food-vending.

Madel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Siasa

texts.en:
Siasa is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Siasa has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby.  

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en:
Neciforo is 59 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. A widowed father of an adult-aged child, he has had a motorcycle transport service for 20 years and earns approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month. He has also a sari-sari store business and receives a monthly pension as his wife's survivor.

Neciforo has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. A member of PMPC for nine years, he hopes to acquire an additional tricycle for hire in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail

loans.name: Blanca Sulemy

texts.es:
Blanca tiene un gran sueño e ilusión y es el poder tener su propio salón de belleza el cual sea bien reconocido y tenga una muy buena acogida por los habitantes del municipio de Apartado.
Ella estudio estética y Belleza en una academia muy reconocida, y desde el momento que se graduó se propuso a emprender con su propio negocio, el problema que tiene es la falta de capital para iniciar y es por eso que guarda la esperanza de poder obtener los recursos suficientes a través de este medio.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y se siente la energía positiva que transmite cada vez que habla de su futuro.
El dinero seria invertido en la compra de sillas de corte, estanterías y lavacabezas, además de herramientas de trabajo como maquinas de motilar, tijeras, cuchillas, etc.
Otra parte del dinero será para pagar el arriendo del local.
texts.en:
Blanca has a big dream, which is having her own beauty salon. She would like it to be well-known and well accepted by the residents of the municipality of Apartado. She studied aesthetics and beauty in a reputed academy and started her own business right after graduating. Her problem is the lack of start-up capital, but she is hopeful she will obtain the necessary resources thanks to this loan. She is an entrepreneur and is full of positive energy that she shows every time she talks about her future. 

She will use the loan to buy chairs, shelves and sinks, as well as utensils such as shaving machines, scissors, razor blades, etc. She will also use a portion of the money to cover rental expenses.

loans.use: to buy furniture and utensils, and to cover rental expenses for the salon.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 33-year-old married woman with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. She has a retail shop where she sells general merchandise and a motorcycle transport business that provides added income. Competition is her major challenge while she dreams to have a good home and educate her children up to university level. Margret wants a loan to buy salt, chapatis, sodas, popcorn and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, chapatis, sodas, popcorn and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is 30 years old and sells stationery and books to the general public. He started his business in 2013 hoping to earn enough income to take care of his needs. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to boost his business. Philip is requesting a loan to buy stationery and books to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationery and books to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hard-working woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married with four children, none in school.
She lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water.
She operates a taxi business in the coastal region, carrying her passengers from one place to another.
She is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for her three-wheeled taxi. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her three-wheeled taxi

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George provides transportation services in his community to make a living. With his income, he was able to provide for his family and repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying tires. He took out a new loan to repair his existing transport vehicle.

In the future, he wants to have a better transportation service so that he could earn more for a comfortable and improved standard of living.

loans.use: to repair his existing transport vehicle.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona earns a living by helping her husband work on their farm. She has used her income to successfully repay a previous loan she took out to buy feed for her animals. She is always looking for ways to provide a better living to her three children, and is requesting a new loan to buy more feed for her animals and to expand the building in which she houses them.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en: Ponciano owns operates a transportation service in his community to make a living. He has been engaged in his business for five years and earns well from it. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for vehicle repair. Ponciano is requesting a new loan to buy spare parts and renew his motor vehicle registration. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and renew his motor vehicle registration.

loans.name: Jhon Marco

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Lambayeque junto a su familia.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja como Operario de Construcción y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajador, entusiasta y con muchos deseos de superación.
Jhon está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá iniciar los trámites para poder adquirir su licencia de conducir y así pueda generar otros ingresos trabajando como chofer, con esto podrá ayudar a su familia y más adelante poder cumplir una de sus metas: "Seguir una carrera universitaria".
texts.en:
Jhon is a young entrepreneur. He is 20 years old, single and lives in Lambayeque with his family. 

He has worked as a construction worker for the past two years and things are going very well for him because he is a very responsible, hard working, enthusiastic person with a desire to get ahead. 

Jhon is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him he has been able to start the process to attain his drivers license. 

This way he will be able to earn income as a driver. He will be able to help his family and in the future reach on of his goals "to study at the university".

loans.use: to pay for drivers license fees.

loans.name: Bartolomea

texts.en:
Bartolomea has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Bartolomea would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 21,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Bartolomea desires to have her own space for business. She also hopes that she will always be healthy and fit to work.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for a new harvest season, such as irrigation, compost and fertilizer and to introduce a method for his plants to endure the winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shelving, display cases, inventory and to make some improvements on the locale.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en: Julian is 25 years old and started a mobile money business to meet her needs. She desires to increase her business but is challenged by competition and the general network problem that delays her service delivery. However, Julian is getting credit to add more capital to her mobile money business.

loans.use: to add more capital to her mobile money business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with one child who is still underage. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a clothes-selling business in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Bovel district of Battambang province, Ra is 35 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids. To support her two dependent children who are too young for schooling, she does rice cropping and works as a paid-worker to support her daily cost of living. The business that she has occupied for 10 years has earned her about 39,500 KHR per day. 

Ra is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and to pay the plowing fee. She strongly believes that she can make more income so that she can uplift her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer, is age 42, single, and a mother of three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost three years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her income from this business usually is spent on her electric bill and food expenses. Due to insufficient funds she would like a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, candies, and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and expand.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, candies, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Devi Joy

texts.en: Devi Joy is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management at her university. She wants to finish her studies and find a better job in order to earn money of her own and help her family. She joined GDMPC this year and is requesting a loan to pay tuition fees for the current semester. She is grateful for the opportunities that she get from her schooling and from loans like this.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for this semester

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva owns and operates a general store, selling grocery goods in her local community to make a living. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying goods to sell. Her revenue goes mostly to her daily expenditures and she can't afford to expand her business on her own. With this, she took a new loan recently, to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Primitiva plans to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Saroub's Group

texts.en: Saroub, a resident from the Bovel district of Battambang province, is 34 years old and the mother of three children. She is a cassava farmer and also has a paid working job to supplement her income. She has been involved in farming for 12 years. This is the first loan for Saroub with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has teamed up with another borrower to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings and insecticide for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and insecticide

loans.name: Choum's Group

texts.en: A villager from the Bovel district, Choum is 54 years old and a married mother blessed with four children. To secure her family's needs, rice cropping and cassava farming are the main source of income for Choum. She also has a paid working job as her secondary source of income. A first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Choum leads a group of two to get a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide for her cassava farm. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy insecticide for her farm.

loans.name: Erika Del Rosario

texts.es:
Erika de 34 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora que día con día se empeña en sacar a delante a su familia  y llevar el sustento diario al hogar. Debido a las condiciones económicos, ella externo que solo pudo estudiar hasta octavo grado, porque tenía que dedicarse al negocio (tienda) y estudiar y le resulto muy difícil entonces se dedicó a vender.

 Actualmente está acompañada su esposo trabaja en un taller automotriz, tienen un hijo de 4 años que nacio con problemas. Entonces parte de las ganancias de la tienda que tienen lo invierten  en comprar medicamento.

Erika tiene una pequeña tienda,  comenta que desde que era muy pequeña se a dedicado a vender,  porque anteriormente la mamá tenia tienda y así aprendió el negocio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, fósforos, sal, pan, bebidas, helados, embutidos, etc. Y para comprar medicamentos para su hijo. 

Su deseo es ampliar más su tienda y poder darle a su hijo una educación de calidad,  las ganancias que obtenga las invertirá en comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Erika is 34 years old. She is a very enterprising woman who is a fighter. Day to day, she strives to get her family ahead and bring home the daily support. Due to financial conditions, she said that she was only able to go to school up to the eighth grade, because she she had to work in the business (store) and go to school and it was very hard so she decided to just work.  

She is married now and her husband works in an auto shop. They have a 4 year old son who was born with problems.  A part of the earnings from the store has to be invested in buying medication. 

Erika has a little store. She says that since she was very little she has works as a sales person because her mother had a store before and that is how she learned the business. 

The loan she is asking for is to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, matches, salt, bread, beverages, ice cream, deli meats, etc. She will also buy medication for her son. 

She wants to expand her store and give her son a quality education. The profits will be invested in buying more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, matches, salt, bread, beverages, ice cream, deli meats, et. Also, to buy medication for her son.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Phea, a citizen from Bovel district of Battambang province, is 29 years old and a mother of one dependent son. For her family, farming rice on two hectares  and her paid-working job are the main sources of her family’s income. 

Including this loan, Phea and her joint borrower are in their second cycle. They have fully repaid their past loan, which enabled them to progressively improve their lifestyles. 

Now, Phea and her joint borrower are seeking a loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, Phea will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and to pay for plowing. She hopes that this loan will help her to replant her crop in a timely manner, with a good yield in return.

loans.use: to buy seed and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a leather cover, a door and maintenance for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles, wood and galvanized sheeting to repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory of cell phones and replacement parts for them.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Rom Mark is 18 years old and the fourth of six children in his family. His mother Marietta is a member of NWFT and supports her family by running a store in the Philippines. Rom Mark is studying marine engineering and is currently in the third year of a four-year program. Marietta has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to pay for his tuition for the current semester. Rom Mark is working hard to graduate and get a job.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en: Nam, a local farmer residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province, is 46 years old and has four children. As a breadwinner in the family, she does rice farming and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years. This is Nam's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’’s partner). She and her joint borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay plowing fees, to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay labor costs. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and labor costs and buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking man who wants to become successful in the future. He plans to work abroad after finishing his studies. 

He has a part time job in a private institution and it helps a lot for his basic needs. He needs additional financial support for his school expenses because his savings and income are not enough to cover the costs. He has been a member of GDMPC for two years and now he has borrowed a loan to cover the costs of school materials and books. 

He is hoping for a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school materials and books

loans.name: Kimhak's Group

texts.en:
Kimhak is a citizen of Kam Rieng district in Battambang province. She is 56 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are in school. To support her big family, she grows maize and cassava and sells vegetable as her main source of income. Additionally, she earns extra income by working for others for a fee. 

Kimhak has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle, with a successful repayment of her loan. Now she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and to buy corn seed. She hopes that she can double her income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy corn seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, an assortment of grains, and basic goods to start his own shop.

loans.name: Meldrina

texts.en:
Meldrina is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Meldrina is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Meldrina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Meldrina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits like mangoes to sell. Meldrina has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Meldrina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like mangoes to sell

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en: Vannak was born in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province and is 33 years old and the mother of one child child who is too young to go to school. She earns a living by selling various items and by growing cassava. She has been in this business for ten years, and has taken out and repaid a previous loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now the leader of a two-person loan group whose members are requesting a new loan of 1,600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds, and to pay a plowing and transplanting fee. She strongly believes that this loan will allow her to grow a higher yield than in the past.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, and to pay a plowing and transplanting fee

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 20 years now. Merly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines  for three years and also earns income from selling electronic mobile phone loads.

Paz has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Paz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 55-year-old married woman with eight children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rebecca has a repair and welding shop in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Rebecca has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. Roselyn has a live-in partner and sells dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Roselyn has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia works hard to support her family. She is married and sells nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Simplicia has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like bread, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, cereals, detergent soap, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like bread, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, cereals, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Eleonadi

texts.es:
Eleonadi es un joven  de 22 años de edad, muy emprendedor que a pesar de la adversidades siempre a salido adelante  debido a la falta de recursos económicos  solo estudio hasta 3 grado y porque se iba con el papá a pescar. Por ello era muy irregular la asistencia a clases entonces opto por dedicarse solo a la pesca. Él solo vive con su papá.


 Trabaja con el papá y el horario es variable de acuerdo con la marea que se presente en ese momento, por lo general salen a las 6 de la mañana y regresan a las 6 de la tarde, debido a la escases que cada día es mas evidente de peses eso implica desplazarse a mas distancia mar a dentro.


El préstamo que esta solicitadno, es para comprar una lancha, ya que con la que pescan es prestada y muchas veces si el dueño le llega una propuesta  mejor la presta a otra persona y se quedamos sin trabajar; pero ahora con la oportunidad que le brindaran con el crédito comprara la lancha y el dinero que utilizaba  para pagar el alquiler de la lancha quedara para ir cancelando el crédito.
texts.en:
Eleonadi a young 22 year old man who is very enterprising. Despite the adversities he has faced he is always moving ahead. Due to a lack of financial resources he only attended school until the third grade. Since he went out with his father to fish, his school attendance was very irregular. Then he decided to devote himself to fishing. He lives alone with his father.

He works with his father and his work schedule is variable in accordance with the nature of the tides at the moment. Generally, he goes out at 6 in the morning and returns at 6 in the afternoon. Owing to a scarcity of fish that is becoming more evident every day, he has to go longer distances out to sea.

The loan Eleonadi is requesting is to purchase a boat because the one they are fishing with now is borrowed and many times if the owner gets a better prospect he loans it to someone else and he and his father are left without work. Now, however, with the opportunity provided through a loan, he will buy a boat and the money that he formerly used to pay rent, he will use to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a boat.

loans.name: Chhat's Group

texts.en: Chhat is a resident from Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. Her main sources of income to support her family, consisting of five children, are from rice farming and her paid working job. She has been involved in her current business for 13 years.  This is not the first loan cycle for Chhat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she joins a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and to pay for plowing and transplanting fees. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy seed and to pay for plowing and transplanting fees.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old and lives in Clarin, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, she has a business selling suman in the community. She earns about 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Evelyn has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her suman business. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two months.  

In the future, she would like to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her suman business

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy requested a PHP 7,000 loan through PMPC to buy more spare parts to use for motorcycle repair.

Jimmy has been in this business for 2 years now.

Jimmy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts.

loans.name: Marshal

texts.en:
Marshal is 29 years old and single. He lives in a rural community with his beloved parents. He engages in a hog-raising business to help his parents in generating income. He aimed to earn and save more income to support the education of his younger brother and to save for his future. He planned to raise more pigs to sell, but he has limited capital. 

For this reason, Marshal wants to access a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional piglets to raise, and materials needed to improve the pigpen. Through patience and hard work, Marshal believes that he will make his business profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional piglets to raise, and materials needed to improve the pigpen.

loans.name: Marycris

texts.en:
Marycris, a 30-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines, has run her processed and frozen meat retailing business for five years. She makes a good income from this. She also sells ice and a variety of fruit juices in Tetra Pak. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyones needs, especially for her three children. She is married, and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have.

What she basically does is buy processed meat products from wholesalers, then she sells them per piece / pack for a profit. Products can range from ham, hotdogs, processed pork and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales everyday.

Marcris is taking out PHP 12,000 loan assistance to buy additional frozen food products and orders for her customers. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more processed meats and fruit juices, which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business, and through it she will be able to give her children the best for their education.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen food and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jonamae

texts.en: Jonamae had a child and lives with her live-in partner in Oroquieta City. To earn an income of her own, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy piglets to add to her existing pigs. She grows pigs and delivers them to town after four months. She gains better income from this activity. She plans to build a pig's shelter for her piggery business.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 50 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at adult age and school age. 

For her means of living, Cherry is engaged in managing a sari-sari store business that sells groceries and other consumable products for 24 years. She earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. Cherry has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. 

In the future, Cherry hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her general store business and is now applying for a PHP 8,628.57 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Florida will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner than she could otherwise. In the future, Florida would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor to rebuild her house after the typhoon.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with two children. One child is in school, and one is too young to attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

For the past five months, she has operated a clothing business selling secondhand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge to business. 

Binti is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

She still operates a business selling shoes and handbags.

Rose is asking for a loan to buy more stock of shoes and handbags for her business. 

She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and handbags for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one school-going child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou, aged 49, lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. She is widowed. She earns a living by farming rice and has been in this business for 30 years. The business currently earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Thou is a four-cycle microloan client with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Yeiner Miguel

texts.es: Yeiner es un agricultor muy trabajador que desde muy pequeño aprendió los oficios del campo con una gran facilidad, comienza sus labores desde muy temprano en la madruga y hace 6 meses se independizo e inicio u criadero de aves donde engorda pollos y gallinas para su posterior venta, este oficio o realiza ante la necesidad de una entrada de dinero para pagar su estudios universitarios, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de cuido para sus aves y aumentar las existencias siguiendo su ritmo de trabajo y deseoso por tener resultado que le permitan estudiar y salir adelante en la vida. Es soltero y vive con sus padres tiene apenas 20 años de edad pero un gran corazón y deseo pro trabajar y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Yeiner is a hardworking farmer who since he was a small boy has learned the work in the fields easily.  He begins his work early in the morning.  Six months ago  Yeiner began working for himself and started raising chickens.  He fattens hens and young chicks for sale. 

Yeiner does this work out of need  for a source of income to pay his university fees.  Yeiner is asking for a loan to take care of the chickens and to increase his stock, keeping up with the pace of work and eager to get results that will allow him to study and get ahead in life.   He is single and lives with his parents.  Yeiner is only 20 years old but has a big heart and the desire to work and be someone in life.

loans.use: to care for his chickens and increase his stock,  as he seeks success in business in order  to pay university fees

loans.name: María Asunción

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación básica, y por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no  pudo continuar, y decidió dedicarse al trabajo de la jarcia que es la elaboración de hamacas, además de esto ella se dedica al trabajo de oficios domésticos.

Está casada su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, ellos tienen 5 hijos 4 están  estudiando, el otro esta pequeño y no estudia,  y 3 de los hijos que están mas grandecitos le ayudan al papa al trabajo de la agricultura.

Ella tiene 22 años de experiencia de dedicarse a la jarcia, ya que aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron desde que dejo de estudiar desde ese entonces, ella se ha dedicado a este trabajo y es así  como se ha ganado la vida desde mucho tiempo, este trabajo lo realiza en tiempos que le queda libre después que atiende a su familia.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar 3 sacos de fertilizante, 2 bolsas de semilla de maíz, 3 bolsas de fertilizante foliar, alquiler del terreno donde ella siembra y pago de mano de obra. 

Ella a futuro desea tener abundante cosecha de su parcela de maíz que le permita tener alimentación suficiente para el gasto de la familia, además con lo que le sobre  de su cosecha ella lo venderá, así podrá tener ingresos para ayudarle a sus hijos con sus estudios, ya que es un sueño que ella tiene que sus hijos lleguen a ser alguien importante en su vida.
texts.en:
María, 44, studied up to the third year of basic education but wasn't able to continue because she lacked the financial resources.  She decided to work in rope-making producing hammocks.  She also does housekeeping work.  She's married and her husband works in agriculture.  They have five children; four attend school and the other one is little and not in school.  The three oldest help their father with the farming.

She has 22 years of experience in rope-making, which she learned from her parents when she stopped attending school.  She has earned a living in this job ever since.  She does this work in her free time after taking care of her family.

The loan she's requesting is to buy three sacks of fertilizer, two bags of corn seed, and three bags of foliar fertilizer, as well as to pay the rent on the land they farm and to pay for labor.

In the future she wants to have an abundant harvest from her corn field so she'll have enough food for the family.  Also, she'll sell what's left over from her harvest to have the income to help her children with their studies, because one of her dreams is for her children to become important people in their lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed, and to pay the rent on her land and to pay for labor

loans.name: Liderando Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
El socio Héctor Gustavo pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Héctor Gustavo tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias  al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio a la vez trabaja en una institución privada, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, hotel, restaurante, transporté, turismo.

La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Héctor Gustavo belongs to the communal bank LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, located in the province and department of Cusco. Héctor Gustavo is 33 years old and single.  He spends his time daily caring for small animals such as guinea pigs.  He has been working at this business for some time, which works out well for him thanks to the hard work he puts in each day.   At the same time he works in a private institution.

Héctor wants to continue working in this way to get ahead.  This loan is part of one of the lines of credit of the Asociación Arariwa called "Credi Yapa."  This line of credit is granted to borrowers with a good credit history, and this is a group which has those characteristics.   The member asks for this loan to buy guinea pigs for his business.  He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.   The other members work in farming, hotels, restaurants, transportation and tourism.   The  woman whose picture is inserted at the bottom asked to arrive at the meeting late because of her work hours.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for his business.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn Thanh Hà Xã Trung Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyến works in agriculture raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultrys to raise and sell in future.

Tuyến is 45 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn Thanh Hà Xã Trung Chính Group solidarity group, which consists of three members.

In 2013, Tuyến  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tuyến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Tuyến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyến hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultrys to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Xuân Thịnh, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.
Oanh is 54 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the Nhóm 03 Thôn Xuân Thịnh, Yên Mỹ solidarity group. 

In 2012, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Oanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Salve Regina

texts.en: Salve Regina is married and settled to earn her living in Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with her family. Over the past two years, Salve Regina was able to put up a snack vending business that absolutely met the needs of her customers' tastes. She gains more customers for she prepares and cooks snacks with better and improved taste. Until now, the business is still doing well and she is earning enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. She added groceries in her store and she gained more returns. Salve Regina joined GDMPC earlier this year to have easy access to financial services. Her first loan application from the cooperative has been approved. The loan is intended to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell. Salve Regina expects an increase in sales to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 64 years old. She is known in the Lopez Jaena area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers.  

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, age 60, is happy tending her little store. She is now widow and living with her children. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and she makes promising daily sales. Elena keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Elena believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.

Elena has reached her 3rd year of being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000 for the store. Elena will buy canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there a good and happy life with her children.

loans.use: buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits to sell

loans.name: Amparita

texts.en: Amparita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Amparita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Amparita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 27 years old and married with two children; both are in school. Flordelisa works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Flordelisa has restarted her livestock raising business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7,850 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Flordelisa is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
At the age of 57 years old, Yen is a Khmer food seller in a small market in her village. Yen lives in the Ang Snul District of Kandal Province and she has two unmarried children. Her husband is a construction worker in one private construction company . This couple can earn about US $8 per day.

Yen wants to improve her family's living conditions and health by having a latrine in her house, but she doesn't have enough money to afford a good one. So, now she is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Yen hopes that a latrine will give her a comfortable life and keep protecting the environment around her house.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, a 42-year-old mother of four, helps her husband operate their own piggery, while he works in a private company as a welder. For many years of growing and selling pigs, the couple was able to provide the family. She had to be determined in her work to give a better education to her children. 

In order to boosts her pigs, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase feeding supplies. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful, and she wants to expand her business for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Jasmin works hard to support her family.

She has a bag making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified water. Jasmin is borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her bag-making business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her bag-making business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from dressmaking.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, wood etc, for her business

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 38 years old and single. 

Olive runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

In the future, Olive would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amanda De Jesus

texts.es:
Amanda es una humilde mujer de corazón noble y grandes habilidades en la cocina, tanto así que desde hace 13 años inicio con su negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como desayunos y almuerzos que vende por encargos.
Es una mujer muy reconocida por su sazón y forma de cocinar.
Hoy en día desea renovar su actividad y trabajar de una manera mas cómoda y eficiente, por eso solicita un auxilio par compra utensilios de cocina nuevos, reemplazando los que tiene en mal estado, adicionalmente comprara los ingredientes necesarios para sus preparaciones y capitalizara su negocio.
Esta es la oportunidad que Amanda había esperado siempre, pues solo así podrá ganar más clientes y obtendrá más ingresos producto de su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Amanda is a a humble woman with a noble heart and great abilities in the kitchen, so much so that 13 years ago she began her business of preparing and selling food such as breakfasts and lunches, prepared to order.
 
She is well-known for  the flavor and style of her cooking.   Today she wants to renew her business and work in a more comfortable and efficient way.  For this she is seeking help to buy new cookware, replacing ones in bad shape,  She will also buy necessary ingredients for cooking and will invest in her business.   This is the opportunity Amanda had always hoped for, since she will be able to get more customers and income as the product of her efforts.

loans.use: to buy new cookware and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is 68 years old and lives in Poblacion, Clarin, Philippines.  He is widowed with 2 children. 

Miguel is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan to provide additional capital for his rice farming business.

Miguel has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Miguel hopes to save more to support his family members.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for his rice farming business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Nilda is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to build a tailoring shop at public market.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 18 years old and is the second of three children in the family.

Mark is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Maritime Transportation, and is currently in the third year of this three-year course.

Mark is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

When he graduates, Mark plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 24 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a business of direct selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like perfume, body-lotion etc.

Bernadette has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Bernadette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like perfume, body-lotion etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 26 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for farming coconut. Jennifer has been farming coconut for five years and also earns additional income from manicure and pedicure and buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for farming coconut

loans.name: Kimfer

texts.en:
Kimfer is 21 years old and is the youngest of six children in his family.

Kimfer is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Marine Engineering and is currently in the third year of this three-year course.

Kimfer is borrowing 14,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year.

When he graduates, Kimfer plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Lielane Rose

texts.en:
Lielane Rose is 20 years old and is the fourth of seven children in the family. 

Lielane Rose is studying computer science and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

Lielane Rose is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Lielane Rose plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Voeun is 25 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She has one child. Farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately 25,000 KHR per day.

This is the third loan for Voeun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business, so as to earn a larger income to make a living better and keep her children in school.

Note: This picture, she took at her neighbor's grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 40-year-old, hard-working woman, from village Rodinauli. She has a husband and two sons. The family's only source of income is from agricultural activity. In particular, Nana and her husband are engaged in cow and sheep breeding, and producing milk products that are sold locally. Also, they have several chickens and Nana utilizes these products for family use only. However, this income is hardly enough to meet even basic needs in a family of four.  Because of this, Nana has planned to start another stable activity, which will increase the living conditions of her family. She has requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. She will use this mentioned loan amount 5,000 GEL for purchasing stocks of needed food products and open a grocery store. This store will be located in a good area of their village, and will have its own local customers and passersby. 

Nana looks forward for your help and will highly appreciate it, as she will get chance to provide a good education for her sons for progressing in life, and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of needed food for a grocery store.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonieta is 40 years old and has five children who are currently in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 67 years old and widowed with eight children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Basilisa has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns aadditional income from buying and selling dry goods.

Basilisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 38 years of age and a resident of Brgy. Doña Lucia, Quezon, Nueva Ecija. Aside from being a mother to her two daughters, Janet also works as a vendor. On the other hand, Geraldo, her husband, works as a farmer. As a mother she wants her children to finish their college education. For that she is requesting a loan of 200,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Kiva lenders thru ASKI for the full tuition fee of her eldest child, Christine Kier. Christine Kier wants to take up civil engineering, for she believes that through that she can showcase God’s gift to her. Also, with a college diploma, she is certain that she can achieve her dreams of giving her family a better living in which they can buy all their needs and wants as well.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fee of her eldest daughter

loans.name: Junjie

texts.en:
Junjie is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of his family’s home. He is a PMPC client who previously received a loan to meet his financial needs for his retail business. He has maintained his membership in good standing through a successful repayment record.

Junjie is now applying for a 50,000 PHP loan through PMPC to buy materials for a new roof for his house. He is thankful for PMPC’s help and the fact that his family will be able to live comfortably in their newly renovated house.

loans.use: to buy materials for a new roof for his house.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en: Rico is single with no children. He is 43 years old and lives in Lupagan Clarin, Philippines. Rico is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan to buy 15 sacks of fertilizers. Rico has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Rico hopes to save more for future consumption.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund has faithfully paid back his previous loan which he used for his business. He also has been operating his own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than three years and he makes a good living from this. He sustains all his needs through his business while being able to help his family at the same time. He also is determined to establish a new business.

To improve sales, Raymund would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 10,000, he could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his store. He sincerely expresses his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Raymund hopes to further increase her profit from business for he dreams of becoming rich someday.

He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, when he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his store.

loans.name: Artimia

texts.en:
Artimia is 81 years old, widowed with 3 children and lives in Pan-ay Clarin,Philippines.

Artimia sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 8000 to restock store with basic commodities.

Artimia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Artimia hope to save more for future consumption.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en: Desideria is 43 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. Desideria is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Desideria has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Desideria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For his daughter's wedding party.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is is 42 years old, widowed with 4 children and lives in Taguima Tudela,Philippines.

Elena sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Elena has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Elena hope to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 64 years old and married. For the past three years she has raised pigs to sell in the Philippines. To sustain her pig business she has previously taken out and successfully repaid seven loans through NWTF.

Carmelita is now requesting a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to continually raise the expansion of her pig business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Randolf

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Randolf works hard to support his family.

He has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Randolf is borrowing 60,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment like fishing net, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc., for his fishing business.

Randolf has been sustaining his business activities through his past 24 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment like fishing net, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Jenny Maria

texts.es: Jenny es una laboriosa, humilde, respetuosa y sobretodo sonriente mujer dedicada a la venta de productos por catálogo, oficio que aprendió gracias a una amiga y con el que hace ya 3 años le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y porque no darse unos pequeños gusticos como sus rumbas y detalles que muy merecidamente tiene, de este feliz matrimonio nació un hijo por el cual ha velado, para que en un futuro se convierta en un gran estudiante y profesional  por esta razón realizan ahorros para pagar sus estudios universitarios pues manifiestan que el estudio y el conocimiento son la única herramienta para salir de la pobreza honradamente, sus ventas vas desde vestuario, cosméticos y productos de cuidado personal por lo que quiere aprovechar las promociones de revista y realizar un pedido en gran cantidad para comprar a bajo precio y obtener una buena utilidad por ellos. Se sueña con tener un gran almacén de variedades en vestuario, cosméticos y productos de uso personal que le permita mejorar su vida llevando siempre una sonrisa en su rostro lo que demuestra que es feliz ejerciendo su profesión
texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking, humble, respectful and happy woman.  She works selling catalog products, a business that she learned thanks to a friend.  She has been doing it for three years and she helps her husband with the household expenses.  She also treats herself from time to time with parties and different items that are well earned.  From her happy marriage, she has one child for whom she has made sure that in the future he can become a great student and professional.  For this reason, they are saving to pay for his college education.  They believe that education and knowledge are the only tools to honorably get out of poverty.  

She sells clothing, cosmetics and personal care products, which is why wants to take advantage of the catalog promotions and make a large order to purchase merchandise at low prices and generate greater profits.  Her dream is to have a large store with a variety of clothing, cosmetics and personal care products that will allow her to improve her life.  She always wears a smile on her face that shows how happy she is in her profession.

loans.use: purchase catalog products in bulk to make a good profit from selling them.

loans.name: Sros's Group

texts.en:
Sros is 37 years old and a mother, blessed with three children. A one-hectare rice farm is the only source of income to support her family. 

Sros has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) once as a first-time borrower with a successful repayment. The positive impact of her previous loan has improved at a gradual pace, indeed.  

Now, she teams up with a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for labor costs, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crops. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Fanny Flor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose a brindar el servicio de movilidad escolar, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su carro.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "Liderando las Palmeras".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the Cusco region.  She works providing school transportation.  She has worked in this business for many years and it satisfies her both financially and personally.  She hopes to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.  She is seeking a loan to purchase tires for her care.  She is grateful for those who are taking part in this dream through this medium, and she is committed to complying with the loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: purchase tires for her car.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. Since then she has restarted selling vegetables and is now applying for a 8,471 PHP housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and pay for labor to reconstruct the family’s house.

Ma. Gina’s goals are to save money to grow her vegetable business and send her children to college. With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: An $800 loan is offered to Luisa to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as long sleeved and short sleeved shirts, trousers and shorts. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Luisa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy long sleeved and short sleeved shirts, trousers and shorts.

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en:
Lorn, age 49, lives with her husband and two children in a village in the Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district in Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for nearly 31 years. They supplement the family’s income by working as paid workers.

Lorn has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles and she completely paid back the previous loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood and keep her children in school. 

Now she earns about 27,800 KHR per day from her current business. She is requesting another loan to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy farm and use a portion of it to buy feed for her chicken-raising business. 

With this loan, Lorn hopes to increase her family’s income so as to better her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mik's Group

texts.en:
Mik, 49, is from a rural village located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is married with seven children. She and her husband earn a living through corn, cassava and bean farming and fishing. She and her husband have been in this business for almost two years. The current business earns her family about 24,000 KHR per day.

This is a microloan for Mik with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a seventh-time borrower. As the leader, she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement, blocks, sand, iron, doors and windows.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven de 23 años de edad madre de un niño.
Ella pudo completar sus estudios secundarios gracias a la ayuda económica de sus padres, ahora su vida la dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas en un mercado de la zona; “comencé vendiendo bebidas gaseosas personales de tres sabores, mi negocio fue creciendo y la demanda también, ahora vendo bebidas de todo tamaño y de todos los sabores” comenta Daniela. Ella es soltera y vive con su niño de apenas dos años de edad, lo transporta en un carrito para bebe y él la sigue a todas partes.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y a las largas jornadas de trabajo que realiza diariamente llegó a conseguir nuevos clientes cada vez más grandes, ahora maneja pedidos diarios para restaurantes, oficinas y otros comercios.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande porque existe bastante demanda que todavía no logra abarcar por la falta de recursos económicos, ella necesita ampliar su negocio para eso está en busca de una inversión económica que le ayude a satisfacer la demanda.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela solicita un préstamo para la compra de refrescos por mayor y así satisfacer la demanda existente.
texts.en:
Daniela is 23 years old and is a mother to one son.  She was able to complete her high school education thanks to her parents' financial support.  Today, she works selling soda in a local market.  She states that she started selling three flavors of personal-sized sodas, however, her business grew and her demand increased and now she sells beverages in all flavors and sizes.  She is single and lives with her two year old son.  She carries him in a stroller and he goes everywhere with her.  Thanks to her efforts and her long work days, she has been able to gain new and bigger clients.  She now manages daily orders for restaurants, offices and other businesses.

Her dream is to have a larger business because there is a lot of demand that she is not able to satisfy based on her lack of financial resources.  She is in need of expanding her business, which is why she is seeking financial help that will help her to satisfy this demand.  For this reason, Daniela is seeking a loan to purchase beverages in bulk and meet the existing demand.

loans.use: purchase beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Mang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Mang is 36 years old and the mother of three schoolchildren. 

For her family, rice farming and pig-raising are the main sources for her to earn income for 14 years. She also earns extra income via a rice-grinding business. This current business has earned her 36,700 KHR per day.
