Included in this cycle, Mang is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it uplifts her lifestyle progressively. 

Now she leads a group of five to get a new loan. The entire loan amount in her group is 6,600,000 KHR, of which 2,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy pigs and fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to gain more income via this business.

loans.use: To buy pigs and fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Heoung's Group

texts.en: Heoung is a villager located in the Moung Kol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 60 years old and a married mother of three kids. Currently, only one of them is relying on her and still in school. For her household, her chicken-raising business and paid-working job for others for a fee are the way for her to earn income. She has been engaged in these businesses for 40 years with a decent income of 20,000 KHR per day. She has been a borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages and she has completely paid her past loans. The loans have enabled her to improve her standard of living. For this cycle, she is a leader of a group of two members. She and her group member are seeking a loan of 100,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy bran for her chickens. She hopes to run a new business so that she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bran for her chickens

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase work tools.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en: Emilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business. NWTF is relisting Emilda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net and gasoline for her pumpboat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs like fertilizer, manure and irrigation to prepare the land.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 48 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Primitiva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Primitiva has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and earns additional income from raising cattle.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gerson

texts.en:
Gerson is 40 years old. He is very responsible with his household obligations and he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans and, at the same time, he works as a laborer.

Gerson wants to increase his sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly is 32 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Rosaly works very hard to provide for them.

Rosaly's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosaly has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosaly has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosaly is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

Sonia has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle
